If you&#8217;re using large nuts like pecans, transfer them to a cutting board and chop them into small pieces with a chef&#8217;s knife.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/easy-salted-fudge-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make the fudge: In a medium-sized, heavy-bottomed pot, combine the nut butter, chocolate chips, sweetener, butter, salt and cinnamon. You can do it!", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/easy-salted-fudge-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Carefully dump the fudge mixture into your lined square baker. If you&#8217;re finishing the fudge with flaky sea salt, lightly sprinkle some on top now and gently press it into place with the bottom of your parchment-covered glass.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/easy-salted-fudge-recipe/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cover and freeze the fudge for 30 to 45 minutes, until it&#8217;s firm to the touch and no longer shiny in the middle. It would be a lovely dish on your holiday table or a great weeknight dinner on its own. Recipe yields 4 main dish servings to 8 side servings, depending on portions.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "carrots with farro", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2015/10/roasted-carrots-with-farro-and-chickpeas-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2015/10/roasted-carrots-with-farro-and-chickpeas-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2015/10/roasted-carrots-with-farro-and-chickpeas-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2015/10/roasted-carrots-with-farro-and-chickpeas.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/roasted-carrots-recipe-with-farro-chickpeas/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 cup dried farro, rinsed", "1 teaspoon extra virgin olive oil", "1 teaspoon lemon juice", "1 clove garlic, pressed or minced", "&frac12; teaspoon salt", "1 can (15 ounces) chickpeas, rinsed and drained, or 1 &frac12; cups cooked chickpeas", "1 pound slender heirloom carrots, scrubbed clean and patted dry (I didn&#8217;t peel mine)", "1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil", "&frac14; teaspoon ground cumin", "Salt and pepper", "3 tablespoons pepitas (green pumpkin seeds)", "&frac12; teaspoon extra virgin olive oil", "Pinch of cumin", "Pinch of chili powder", "Pinch of salt", "&#8531; cup cr\u00e8me fra\u00eeche", "1 tablespoon chopped fresh parsley", "2 teaspoons water", "Salt and pepper, to taste", "1 more tablespoon chopped fresh parsley"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To cook the farro: In a medium saucepan, combine the rinsed farro with at least three cups water (enough water to cover the farro by a couple of inches). Bring the water to a boil, then reduce heat to a gentle simmer. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the farro is tender to the bite but still pleasantly chewy (pearled farro will take around 15 minutes; unprocessed farro will take 25 to 40 minutes). Drain off the excess water and return the farro to the pot. Add 1 teaspoon olive oil, the lemon juice, garlic and &frac12; teaspoon salt. Mix well, then add the chickpeas and stir to combine. Set aside, covered, until you\u2019re ready to assemble.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/roasted-carrots-recipe-with-farro-chickpeas/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To roast the carrots: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit. Line a large, rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper and add the carrots. Drizzle them with 1 tablespoon olive oil and sprinkle with cumin, salt and pepper. Use your fingers to make sure the carrots are lightly and evenly coated in oil and spices. Roast for 20 to 35 minutes, until the carrots are easily pierced by a fork near the top of their stems. Roasting time will depend entirely on the size of your carrots. I removed some of the more slender carrots at 20 minutes and checked them at 5 minute intervals thereafter, removing the carrots as they were done.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/roasted-carrots-recipe-with-farro-chickpeas/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To toast the pepitas: In a small skillet over medium heat, warm &frac12; teaspoon olive oil until shimmering. Add the pepitas and generous pinches of cumin, chili powder and salt. Cook, stirring frequently, until the pepitas are turning golden on the edges and starting to make little popping noises. Remove from heat to cool.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/roasted-carrots-recipe-with-farro-chickpeas/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To make the herbed cr\u00e8me fra\u00eeche, combine the cr\u00e8me fra\u00eeche, 1 tablespoon chopped parsley, water, and a few dashes of salt and pepper in a small bowl. Stir to combine and set aside.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/roasted-carrots-recipe-with-farro-chickpeas/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To assemble the dish, pour the farro and chickpea mixture onto a large serving platter. Arrange the carrots in a single layer over the mixture. Drizzle herbed cr\u00e8me fra\u00eeche generously over the carrots, then sprinkle them with pepitas and one tablespoon chopped fresh parsley. Serve immediately or let the dish cool to room temperature (it\u2019s good either way!).", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/roasted-carrots-recipe-with-farro-chickpeas/#instruction-step-5"}], "prepTime": "PT15M", "cookTime": "PT45M", "totalTime": "PT1H", "recipeYield": ["4", "4 to 8 servings"], "recipeCategory": "Entree", "cookingMethod": "Various", "recipeCuisine": "N/A", "suitableForDiet": "VegetarianDiet", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "92", "ratingValue": "4.9"}, "nutrition": {"servingSize": "", "calories": "249 calories", "sugarContent": "6 g", "sodiumContent": "314.3 mg", "fatContent": "8.4 g", "saturatedFatContent": "2.9 g", "transFatContent": "0 g", "carbohydrateContent": "35.9 g", "fiberContent": "8.4 g", "proteinContent": "6.9 g", "cholesterolContent": "8.3 mg", "@type": "nutritionInformation"}, "video": {"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "VideoObject", "name": "\u201dRoasted", "description": "\u201dWatch", "contentUrl": "https://content.jwplatform.com/videos/&rdquo;1FHW0uju&rdquo;.mp4", "thumbnailUrl": ["https://content.jwplatform.com/thumbs/&rdquo;1FHW0uju&rdquo;-720.jpg"], "uploadDate": "1970-01-01T00:00:00+00:00"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Rita"}, "datePublished": "2025-07-08", "reviewBody": "Wow, made this for lunch today. It\u2019s easy and fun to make, too. Recipe yields 4 generous bowls of soup.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "Vegetarian pho", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2017/01/vegetarian-pho-recipe-1-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2017/01/vegetarian-pho-recipe-1-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2017/01/vegetarian-pho-recipe-1-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2017/01/vegetarian-pho-recipe-1.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegetarian-pho-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["Two 3-inch cinnamon sticks", "3 whole cloves", "2 star anise", "1 large white onion*, peeled and quartered", "4-inch piece of fresh ginger*, peeled and halved lengthwise", "4 cups (32 ounces) vegetable stock or broth", "4 cups water", "2 tablespoons reduced-sodium tamari or soy sauce", "6 ounces (one large handful) rice noodles", "1 tablespoon avocado oil, mild extra-virgin olive oil or your neutral-flavored oil of choice", "5 ounces thinly sliced shiitake mushrooms", "Salt", "Mung bean sprouts", "Sprigs of fresh basil (use Thai basil if you can find it) or cilantro", "Sprigs of fresh mint", "Thinly sliced green onions (mostly green parts)", "Very thinly sliced fresh jalape\u00f1o (omit if sensitive to spice)", "Small wedges of lime"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Warm a medium soup pot or Dutch oven over medium heat. Add the cinnamon sticks, cloves, and star anise and toast until fragrant, stirring occasionally, about 3 to 4 minutes. Add the onion, ginger, vegetable stock, water and tamari. Raise the heat to high and bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat as necessary to maintain a gentle simmer. Simmer for 30 minutes to give the flavors time to meld.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegetarian-pho-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In the meantime, prepare your rice noodles by cooking them according to package directions. Set them aside.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegetarian-pho-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To prepare the shiitake mushrooms, warm the oil in a medium skillet over medium heat until shimmering. Add the mushrooms and a few dashes of salt. It's bursting with nutritious broccoli! Recipe yields about 6 medium bowls of soup (6 side servings).", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "cream of broccoli soup", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2021/04/cream-of-broccoli-soup-recipe-5-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2021/04/cream-of-broccoli-soup-recipe-5-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2021/04/cream-of-broccoli-soup-recipe-5-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2021/04/cream-of-broccoli-soup-recipe-5.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/cream-of-broccoli-soup-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["4 tablespoons unsalted butter, divided", "2 medium yellow onions, coarsely chopped", "6 garlic cloves, smashed and peeled", "1 \u00bc teaspoon fine sea salt, divided, to taste", "Freshly ground black pepper, to taste", "2 pounds broccoli with stalks (3 large or 4 medium)", "6 cups water", "1 to 2 teaspoons lemon juice, to taste", "Optional garnishes: Drizzle of heavy cream and/or sprinkled of finely snipped fresh chives"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Melt 3 tablespoons of the butter in a large Dutch oven or soup pot over medium-low heat. Add the onion, garlic, \u00bc teaspoon of the salt, and about 10 twists of black pepper.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/cream-of-broccoli-soup-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Stir to combine, then cover the pot and cook, stirring occasionally, until the onions have softened and are just starting to turn golden, about 8 to 10 minutes.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/cream-of-broccoli-soup-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Meanwhile, slice off and discard the rough bottom ends of broccoli stalks. Use a vegetable peeler to peel off the tough outer skin on the stalks, then discard those bits. Slice the stalks off and cut them into pieces about 1 to 2-inches big. Set aside.\u00a0", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/cream-of-broccoli-soup-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Working with the broccoli tops now, cut as closely to the base of the florets as you can. Slice any remaining stalks into chunks to match to the rest. Reserve the broccoli florets\u2014we\u2019ll use them in a bit.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/cream-of-broccoli-soup-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the chunks of broccoli stalk to the pot and stir. Pour in 6 cups water and the remaining 1 teaspoon salt. Raise the heat to high and bring the mixture to a boil, then promptly reduce the heat to medium-low and cover the pot.\u00a0", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/cream-of-broccoli-soup-recipe/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Simmer until the broccoli stalks are tender throughout and easily split apart when pierced with a fork, about 20-25 minutes. Meanwhile, chop the reserved florets into small pieces (I chop them all in one direction, then turn the cutting board and chop again).\u00a0", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/cream-of-broccoli-soup-recipe/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Once the stalks are tender, add all of the florets to pot, stir, cover, and cook until they\u2019re bright green and easily pierced through by a fork, about 4 to 7 minutes. Remove the pot from the heat, and add the remaining tablespoon of butter.\u00a0", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/cream-of-broccoli-soup-recipe/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Working in a couple of batches (never fill your blender past the maximum fill line or it could explode!), carefully transfer several cups of the mixture\u2014both the liquid and solids\u2014to your stand blender. Blend until completely smooth, then transfer the mixture to a heat-proof vessel temporarily as you blend the rest. Alternatively, use an immersion blender (it just won\u2019t be as lusciously creamy). Return the pur\u00e9e to the pot.\u00a0", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/cream-of-broccoli-soup-recipe/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add 1 teaspoon lemon juice. Serve. Leftover soup keeps well in the refrigerator for up to 4 days (you may want to wake up the leftovers with another squeeze of lemon). This soup will freeze well for several months.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/cream-of-broccoli-soup-recipe/#instruction-step-10"}], "prepTime": "PT20M", "cookTime": "PT40M", "totalTime": "PT1H", "recipeYield": ["6", "6 bowls"], "recipeCategory": "Soup", "cookingMethod": "Blended", "recipeCuisine": "American", "suitableForDiet": "VegetarianDiet", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "31", "ratingValue": "4.7"}, "nutrition": {"servingSize": "1 bowl (made with 1.5 teaspoons salt total, no cream)", "calories": "130 calories", "sugarContent": "1.6 g", "sodiumContent": "634.7 mg", "fatContent": "8.3 g", "saturatedFatContent": "4.9 g", "transFatContent": "0 g", "carbohydrateContent": "12.5 g", "fiberContent": "0.7 g", "proteinContent": "5.2 g", "cholesterolContent": "20.4 mg", "@type": "nutritionInformation"}, "video": {"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "VideoObject", "name": "\u201dCream", "description": "\u201dWatch", "contentUrl": "https://content.jwplatform.com/videos/&rdquo;Jt9etqsB&rdquo;.mp4", "thumbnailUrl": ["https://content.jwplatform.com/thumbs/&rdquo;Jt9etqsB&rdquo;-720.jpg"], "uploadDate": "1970-01-01T00:00:00+00:00"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "ivana"}, "datePublished": "2022-02-06", "reviewBody": "If using an instant pot put the stems in the bottom with the water garlic and onions add a steamer on top were you put your florets. Cook with me!", "sameAs": ["https://cookieandkate.com/about/"]}, {"@context": "https://schema.org/", "@type": "Recipe", "name": "Erin's Baked Eggs on a Bed of Roasted Cherry Tomatoes", "description": "Eggs baked on top of tiny halved tomatoes, topped with a sprinkle of Parmesan and basil, make a simple, delicious summertime breakfast or quick dinner. Recipe as written yields 4 medium servings. I highly recommend serving this with toasted bread (goat cheese on whole grain toast is perfect!) or something similar (Erin suggests polenta fries, yum.)", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "baked eggs over tomatoes", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/08/Baked-Eggs-on-a-Bed-of-Roasted-Cherry-Tomatoes-recipe-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/08/Baked-Eggs-on-a-Bed-of-Roasted-Cherry-Tomatoes-recipe-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/08/Baked-Eggs-on-a-Bed-of-Roasted-Cherry-Tomatoes-recipe-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/08/Baked-Eggs-on-a-Bed-of-Roasted-Cherry-Tomatoes-recipe.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/baked-eggs-on-roasted-cherry-tomatoes/", "recipeIngredient": ["3 cups (about 16 ounces) sweet cherry tomatoes or grape tomatoes, halved", "&frac14; cup grated Parmesan", "2 tablespoons olive oil", "2 tablespoons plus 1 teaspoon chopped fresh basil leaves", "1 garlic clove, pressed or minced (optional)", "Sea salt, preferably of the flaky variety (like Maldon)", "Freshly ground black pepper", "4 eggs, at room temperature"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/baked-eggs-on-roasted-cherry-tomatoes/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Arrange the halved tomatoes in an even layer in a medium-sized baking dish (mine was a 9-inch by 9-inch square) or oven-proof skillet. Bake the tomatoes for 12 minutes, then remove the dish. (Erin suggests that if a lot of juice has cooked out of the tomatoes, carefully pour off a little liquid. I didn&#8217;t need to.)", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/baked-eggs-on-roasted-cherry-tomatoes/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Top the tomatoes with all of the Parmesan, drizzle on the olive oil, sprinkle with 2 tablespoons basil and season with salt and pepper. Stir the garlic into the mixture, if using. Gently crack an egg over the tomatoes, keeping the yolk intact. Repeat with the remaining eggs, dispersing them somewhat evenly over the dish.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/baked-eggs-on-roasted-cherry-tomatoes/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Return the dish to the oven and bake for 8 to 10 minutes. Check at 8 minutes\u2014you&#8217;re done when the egg whites have set but the yolks are still soft. They should still jiggle in the centers when you shimmy the pan. (Keep in mind that they&#8217;ll continue cooking after you pull the dish out of the oven.) Recipe yields 1 medium jar of pickles (about 2 cups sliced pickles or 16 spears).", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "refrigerator pickles, dill pickles, cucumber pickles", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2020/08/dill-cucumber-pickles-recipe-2-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2020/08/dill-cucumber-pickles-recipe-2-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2020/08/dill-cucumber-pickles-recipe-2-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2020/08/dill-cucumber-pickles-recipe-2.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-pickles-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 medium-to-large cucumber or 2 small cucumbers (ideally 12 ounces total)*", "&frac12; cup water, at room temperature or cooler", "&frac12; cup rice vinegar", "1 &frac12; tablespoons maple syrup or sugar", "1 &frac12; teaspoons fine sea salt", "&frac14; teaspoon red pepper flakes (optional, for heat)", "20 twists of freshly ground black pepper", "2 leafy sprigs of fresh dill, roughly chopped (about &frac14; cup)", "2 cloves garlic, peeled and smashed", "1 bay leaf"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "For pickle rounds (&#8220;chips&#8221;), slice the cucumber(s) into thin rounds, about &#8539;-inch thick. Or, for spears, slice them in half lengthwise, then slice the halves lengthwise into quarters, then slice the quarters lengthwise into eighths. If your spears are long like mine (from one long cucumber), slice them through the middle so they&#8217;re not too tall for your jar. Set aside.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-pickles-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a liquid measuring cup or bowl, combine the water, vinegar, maple syrup, salt, red pepper flakes (if using) and black pepper. Set aside.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-pickles-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place the cucumbers into a wide-mouth jar about 3 to 4 inches in diameter, tall enough to offer at least 1 inch of extra space on top (for pickle spears, it&#8217;s important that all the pickles fit snugly, vertically\u2014a wide-mouth pint-sized mason jar would work well).", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-pickles-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Top the cucumbers with the dill and garlic. Tuck the bay leaf into the side of the jar. Pour the all of the liquid over the cucumbers so they&#8217;re fully submerged. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour (for pickle rounds) or at least 3 hours (for pickle spears). The flavor will continue to develop over the next couple of days. This recipe is a keeper!\r\nThomas"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Katharine Toldness"}, "datePublished": "2022-08-19", "reviewBody": "Just made and am drinking right now! It is divine! I will make at least one more each for me and the spouse.\r\n\r\nFor the sparkling, I used Fleuraison Blanc De Blanc. It is a good value yet has a lot of tasting notes in common with more famous and expensive sparklers (especially those bready notes).\r\n\r\nThe gin I used is called Empress 1908. Butterfly Pea Blossom gives it a delicate floral note as well as a vivid dark blue color. But add lemon juice and shake with ice and the citrus turns it a delicate violet which looks beautiful in a flute. \r\n\r\nBecause I recently candied a ton of lemon and orange peel, I reserved the remaining syrup to use for cocktails. I made it a rich simple by using a 2-1 sugar to water ratio. This stuff will not spoil. And it has a light citrus note to it. Worked great in this cocktail!\r\n\r\nI added a light dash of angostura bitters. Also, I put the gin, simple syrup, lemon juice and bitters into the shaker before adding the ice to prevent dilution."}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Katharine Toldness"}, "datePublished": "2022-08-19", "reviewBody": "Also, your dog is such a cutie! This recipe is vegan and gluten free. The soup requires some multitasking; you'll be caramelizing the onions in a skillet while you cook the rice and greens in a pot. If you're cooking additional rice as a garnish, you'll need one more pot on the stove (see notes for rice cooking instructions). Recipe yields 6 servings of about 1 2/3 cup soup each.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2014/03/redeeming-green-soup-3-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2014/03/redeeming-green-soup-3-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2014/03/redeeming-green-soup-3-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2014/03/redeeming-green-soup-3.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/redeeming-green-soup-with-lemon-and-cayenne/", "recipeIngredient": ["2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, plus more for garnish", "2 large yellow onions, chopped", "1 teaspoon salt, divided", "2 tablespoons plus 3 cups water, divided", "&frac14; cup arborio rice, rinsed (I used brown arborio rice)", "1 large bunch kale or green chard, preferably organic (about 1 pound)", "14 cups gently packed spinach or baby cooking greens, like chard, preferably organic (about 12 ounces)*", "4 cups vegetable broth", "Big pinch of cayenne pepper, to taste (I used over &frac14; teaspoon)", "1 tablespoon lemon juice, or more to taste", "Serve with (optional): cooked brown basmati rice and cooked chickpeas"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "First prepare the greens: Remove the ribs from the chard/kale and discard or save them for another recipe. Coarsely chop or tear the kale leaves. Trim any tough stems from the spinach/baby greens and roughly chop the leaves.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/redeeming-green-soup-with-lemon-and-cayenne/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Caramelize the onions: Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onions and &frac14; teaspoon salt. Cook, stirring frequently, until the onions begin to brown, about 5 minutes.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/redeeming-green-soup-with-lemon-and-cayenne/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Reduce the heat to low, add 2 tablespoons water and cover the skillet (I used a baking sheet to cover mine). Cook until the onions are greatly reduced and have a deep caramel color, 25 to 30 minutes. Stir frequently while the pan is still hot and occasionally once the pan has cooled down (always recover the pan after stirring).", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/redeeming-green-soup-with-lemon-and-cayenne/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cook the arborio rice: While the onions are cooking, combine the remaining 3 cups water and &frac34; teaspoon salt in a soup pot or Dutch oven. Add rice and bring the water to a boil. Reduce heat to maintain a simmer, cover and cook for 15 minutes.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/redeeming-green-soup-with-lemon-and-cayenne/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "When the rice has cooked for 15 minutes, stir in the chard greens or kale. Return to a simmer; cover and cook for 10 minutes.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/redeeming-green-soup-with-lemon-and-cayenne/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "When the onions are caramelized, stir a little of the simmering liquid into them. Then add the onion mixture to the rice along with the spinach, vegetable broth and cayenne. Return to a simmer, cover and cook, stirring once, until the spinach is tender but still bright green, about 5 minutes more.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/redeeming-green-soup-with-lemon-and-cayenne/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Puree the soup in the pot with an immersion blender until perfectly smooth, or in a regular blender in batches (never fill your blender past the maximum fill line, and be careful with hot soup). Stir in 1 tablespoon lemon juice. Taste and add more lemon juice, sea salt or cayenne pepper, if desired. A classic spritz should be 3:2:1. 3 parts prosecco, 2 parts aperol, and 1 part sparkling water. Obviously it is always to taste, but equal parts aperol and prosecco can be rather syrupy and sickly. Much more refreshing when the classic proportions are followed.\r\nIf you can get it, replace the aperol with Select. In Venice the locals drink Select, the tourists drink aperol. Or for a more bitter, more complex taste, replace the aperol with Campari."}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "diana loreens"}, "datePublished": "2025-07-20", "reviewBody": "I didn\u2019t have any expectations concerning that title, but the more I was astonished. Recipe yields 4 servings.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "tomato pesto, zucchini noodles, pasta recipe", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/07/double-tomato-pesto-with-zucchini-noodles-2-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/07/double-tomato-pesto-with-zucchini-noodles-2-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/07/double-tomato-pesto-with-zucchini-noodles-2-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/07/double-tomato-pesto-with-zucchini-noodles-2.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/double-tomato-pesto-spaghetti-with-zucchini-noodles/", "recipeIngredient": ["8 ounces whole grain spaghetti (DeLallo is my favorite)", "1 large zucchini", "&#8532; cup walnuts", "2 pints (4 cups) cherry or grape tomatoes", "2 tablespoons olive oil, plus more for drizzling", "&frac14; cup oil-packed sun-dried tomatoes, rinsed and drained", "2 garlic cloves, roughly chopped", "&frac12; teaspoon finely grated lemon zest", "1 to 2 tablespoons lemon juice", "&frac14; teaspoon red pepper flakes", "&frac14; teaspoon salt, to taste", "Freshly ground black pepper, to taste", "&frac12; cup lightly packed basil leaves, larger leaves torn into small pieces", "Freshly grated Parmesan cheese or vegan Parmesan, for serving (both optional)", "Olive oil, for drizzling"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bring a large pot of salted water to boil for the spaghetti. Cook the pasta until al dente, according to package directions. Drain and transfer to a large serving bowl. Spiralize the zucchini with a spiralizer (here&#8217;s how), or turn the zucchini into noodles with a julienne peeler, or grate the zucchini the long way on a large box grater.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/double-tomato-pesto-spaghetti-with-zucchini-noodles/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Toast the walnuts: In a medium skillet over medium heat, cook the walnuts, stirring occasionally, until they smell nice and fragrant, about 7 minutes. Set aside to cool.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/double-tomato-pesto-spaghetti-with-zucchini-noodles/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cook the cherry tomatoes: In a large saucepan over medium-high heat, combine the cherry tomatoes, olive oil and a pinch of salt. Cover the pot and cook, stirring occasionally, until the tomatoes have burst open and they are cooking in their own juices, about 7 to 8 minutes. Set aside.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/double-tomato-pesto-spaghetti-with-zucchini-noodles/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a food processor, combine the walnuts, half of the cooked tomatoes, sun-dried tomatoes, garlic, lemon zest, 1 tablespoon lemon juice, red pepper flakes, &frac14; teaspoon salt and several twists of freshly ground black pepper. Blend until the mixture is pretty smooth, then season to taste with additional lemon juice, salt and/or pepper until the flavors really sing (if that doesn&#8217;t do the trick, add some more sun-dried tomatoes). Blend again.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/double-tomato-pesto-spaghetti-with-zucchini-noodles/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour the pesto over the spaghetti and toss to combine. If you&#8217;ll be consuming this dish in one sitting, go ahead and toss in all of the zucchini noodles now, too. (If you plan on having leftovers, store the zucchini noodles separately from the rest, as they leach water when they&#8217;re exposed to salt\u2014I just pile the noodles on top of my individual bowls and wait to stir them in when I&#8217;m ready to eat. Hope that makes sense.)", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/double-tomato-pesto-spaghetti-with-zucchini-noodles/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour the rest of the cherry tomatoes on top of the dish, and sprinkle the basil over them. Toss gently, and divide the mixture into bowls. Top individual bowls with Parmesan or nutritional yeast, if you&#8217;d like, and a light drizzle of olive oil. Grease a 9 by 13-inch pan with butter (don\u2019t be tempted to use cooking spray; it doesn\u2019t work nearly as well).\u00a0", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/healthy-breakfast-casserole-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large skillet, warm the olive oil over medium heat until shimmering.\u00a0 Add the bell pepper and green onion and cook until the pepper is tender and cooked through, about 8 to 10 minutes.\u00a0", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/healthy-breakfast-casserole-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the spinach to the skillet and cook, while stirring, until wilted, about 2 minutes. Add your dairy of choice, several dashes of hot sauce, plus the salt and pepper. Whisk just until the egg yolks and whites are blended.\u00a0", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/healthy-breakfast-casserole-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Stir in half of the cheese (we\u2019re reserving the other half for topping the frittata before baking). Transfer the lightly cooled veggies into the bowl, and stir to combine.\u00a0", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/healthy-breakfast-casserole-recipe/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour the mixture into the prepared pan. Evenly disperse the remaining cheese on top.\u00a0", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/healthy-breakfast-casserole-recipe/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for 25 to 35 minutes (keep an eye on it), until the eggs are puffed and appear cooked, and the center of the frittata just barely jiggles when you give it a gentle shimmy. For good measure, insert a fork about \u00bc-inch into the center of the eggs and make sure the fork comes out clean", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/healthy-breakfast-casserole-recipe/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place the frittata on a cooling rack until you\u2019re ready to serve. Arrange the vegetables in an even layer across each pan. I'll try the vegan suggestion next time.\r\n\r\nI blended the black beans in with half of the salsa so my bean-skeptical offspring wouldn't complain, and they didn't notice the beans at all. The bean/salsa blend was lovely between the layers. \r\n\r\nMy one comment is that it took my oven WAY longer than 30 minutes to bake this casserole, closer to 70. It could have just been my oven, but I advise folks making this to plan ahead in case it takes their oven longer than 30 minutes, too."}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Nancy Benedetto"}, "datePublished": "2025-10-16", "reviewBody": "This is a delicious recipe! Cook with me!", "sameAs": ["https://cookieandkate.com/about/"]}, {"@context": "https://schema.org/", "@type": "Recipe", "name": "Creamy Roasted Pumpkin Soup", "description": "This pumpkin soup recipe is creamy AND healthy! It calls for roasted pumpkin for maximum flavor. This roasted pumpkin soup recipe would look lovely on your holiday dinner table, and leftovers would go great with sandwiches or salads the next day. Recipe yields 4 bowls or 6 cups of soup.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "Pumpkin Soup, fall, Thanksgiving", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2014/11/creamy-vegan-pumpkin-soup-recipe-2-1-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2014/11/creamy-vegan-pumpkin-soup-recipe-2-1-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2014/11/creamy-vegan-pumpkin-soup-recipe-2-1-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2014/11/creamy-vegan-pumpkin-soup-recipe-2-1.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/creamy-vegan-pumpkin-soup/", "recipeIngredient": ["4 tablespoons olive oil, divided", "One 4-pound sugar pie pumpkin", "1 large yellow onion, chopped", "4 large or 6 medium garlic cloves, pressed or minced", "&frac12; teaspoon sea salt", "&frac12; teaspoon ground cinnamon", "&frac12; teaspoon ground nutmeg", "&#8539; teaspoon cloves", "Tiny dash of cayenne pepper (optional, if you like spice)", "Freshly ground black pepper", "4 cups (32 ounces) vegetable broth", "&frac12; cup full fat coconut milk or heavy cream", "2 tablespoons maple syrup or honey", "&frac14; cup pepitas (green pumpkin seeds)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit and line a baking sheet with parchment paper for easy cleanup. Carefully halve the pumpkin and scoop out the seeds (you can roast the seeds if you&#8217;d like\u2014see note\u2014but you won&#8217;t need them for this recipe).", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/creamy-vegan-pumpkin-soup/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Slice each pumpkin halve in half to make quarters. Brush or rub 1 tablespoon olive oil over the flesh of the pumpkin and place the quarters, cut sides down, onto the baking sheet. Roast for 35 minutes or longer, until the orange flesh is easily pierced through with a fork. Set it aside to cool for a few minutes.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/creamy-vegan-pumpkin-soup/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Heat the remaining 3 tablespoons olive oil in a large Dutch oven or heavy-bottomed pot over medium heat. Once the oil is shimmering, add onion, garlic and salt to the skillet. Stir to combine. Cook, stirring occasionally, until onion is translucent, about 8 to 10 minutes. In the meantime, peel the pumpkin skin off the pumpkins and discard the skin.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/creamy-vegan-pumpkin-soup/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the pumpkin flesh, cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves, cayenne pepper (if using), and a few twists of freshly ground black pepper. Use your stirring spoon to break up the pumpkin a bit. Pour in the broth. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for about 15 minutes, to give the flavors time to meld.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/creamy-vegan-pumpkin-soup/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "While the soup is cooking, toast the pepitas in a medium skillet over medium-low heat, stirring frequently, until fragrant, golden and making little popping noises. You want them to be nice and toasty, but not burnt. Transfer pepitas to a bowl to cool.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/creamy-vegan-pumpkin-soup/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Once the pumpkin mixture is done cooking, stir in the coconut milk and maple syrup. Remove the soup from heat and let it cool slightly. You can use an immersion blender to blend this soup in the pot. I prefer to use my stand blender, which yields the creamiest results\u2014working in batches, transfer the contents of the pan to a blender (do not fill your blender past the maximum fill line!). Securely fasten the blender&#8217;s lid and use a kitchen towel to protect your hand from steam escaping from the top of the blender as you pur\u00e9e the mixture until smooth. Transfer the pur\u00e9ed soup to a serving bowl and repeat with the remaining batches.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/creamy-vegan-pumpkin-soup/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Taste and adjust if necessary (I thought the soup was just right as is, but you might want to add more coconut milk for extra creaminess/milder flavor, or maple syrup to make it a little sweeter).", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/creamy-vegan-pumpkin-soup/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Ladle the soup into individual bowls. Sprinkle pepitas over the soup and serve. Or, freeze this soup for up to 3 months.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/creamy-vegan-pumpkin-soup/#instruction-step-8"}], "prepTime": "PT15M", "cookTime": "PT1H10M", "totalTime": "PT1H25M", "recipeYield": ["4", "4 to 6 bowls"], "recipeCategory": "Soup", "cookingMethod": "Roasted and blended", "recipeCuisine": "American", "suitableForDiet": "VegetarianDiet", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "372", "ratingValue": "4.7"}, "nutrition": {"servingSize": null, "calories": "309 calories", "sugarContent": "16.1 g", "sodiumContent": "824.6 mg", "fatContent": "21.2 g", "saturatedFatContent": "7.7 g", "transFatContent": "0 g", "carbohydrateContent": "31.7 g", "fiberContent": "2.8 g", "proteinContent": "4.1 g", "cholesterolContent": "0 mg", "@type": "nutritionInformation"}, "video": {"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "VideoObject", "name": "\u201dPumpkin", "description": "\u201dWatch", "contentUrl": "https://content.jwplatform.com/videos/&rdquo;rUhbzP8W&rdquo;.mp4", "thumbnailUrl": ["https://content.jwplatform.com/thumbs/&rdquo;rUhbzP8W&rdquo;-720.jpg"], "uploadDate": "1970-01-01T00:00:00+00:00"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Renee"}, "datePublished": "2024-11-26", "reviewBody": "The best pumpkin soup I\u2019ve ever made! Thanks to some basic aromatics and Cuban spices, it's incredibly flavorful and delicious. This soup is naturally vegan, vegetarian and gluten free. The recipe yields quite a bit of soup (6 to 8 servings)\u2014it is easily halved, or you can freeze the leftovers.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "black bean soup, canned beans, easy weeknight soup", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/02/vegetarianvegan-black-bean-soup-recipe-3-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/02/vegetarianvegan-black-bean-soup-recipe-3-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/02/vegetarianvegan-black-bean-soup-recipe-3-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/02/vegetarianvegan-black-bean-soup-recipe-3.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/spicy-vegan-black-bean-soup/", "recipeIngredient": ["2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil", "2 medium yellow onions, chopped", "3 celery ribs, finely chopped", "1 large carrot, peeled and sliced into thin rounds", "6 garlic cloves, pressed or minced", "4 &frac12; teaspoons ground cumin", "&frac12; teaspoon red pepper flakes (use &frac14; teaspoon if you&#8217;re sensitive to spice)", "4 cans (15 ounces each) black beans, rinsed and drained", "4 cups (32 ounces) low-sodium vegetable broth", "&frac14; cup chopped fresh cilantro (optional)", "1 to 2 teaspoons sherry vinegar, to taste, or 2 tablespoons fresh lime juice", "Sea salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste", "Optional garnishes: diced avocado, extra cilantro, thinly sliced radishes, tortilla chips&#8230;"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Heat the olive oil in a large Dutch oven or soup pot over medium heat until shimmering. Add the onions, celery and carrot and a light sprinkle of salt. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the vegetable are soft, about 10 to 15 minutes.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/spicy-vegan-black-bean-soup/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Stir in the garlic, cumin and red pepper flakes and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Pour in the beans and broth and bring to a simmer over medium-high heat. Add the rinsed rice and continue cooking, reducing heat as necessary to maintain a lively simmer, for 40 minutes to 55 minutes. It&#8217;s done when the rice is pleasantly tender but still offers a light resistance to the bite. Remove from heat, drain the rice and return the rice to the pot.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/butternut-squash-wild-rice-stuffing-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Meanwhile, roast the butternut: Place the cubed butternut squash on your rimmed baking sheet. Drizzle it with the olive oil and sprinkle with the salt. Toss until the cubes are lightly and evenly coated in oil. Arrange them in a single layer and roast for 35 to 50 minutes, tossing after 20 minutes, until they are starting to turn golden on the edges and tender when pierced through with a fork.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/butternut-squash-wild-rice-stuffing-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "While the wild rice and butternut cook, prepare all of the remaining components. Stir to combine, and cook over medium heat until the pepitas are starting to turn golden on the edges and making little popping noises, about 3 to 5 minutes. Couldn't find pepitas, so I subbed in hazelnuts, which are much easier to find in the UK. Total game changer. Toasted beforehand, they held their crunch even the next day in leftovers. I also stirred in a healthy dose of sauteed shallots, celery and carrots because I believe in the power of mirepoix to elevate any dish. Could only find a butternut squash / sweet potato mix, and found I preferred the sweet potato to the squash. It holds up a little better. Everyone loved the gingery dressing, which really blended so nicely with all the nutty flavors from the wild rice and hazelnuts. Unfortunately, I forgot to use the arils (which I bought) and forgot to buy the goat cheese. Just having too much fun visiting, I guess. This recipe is definitely a keeper and one I'll be riffing on for years. As a gluten free eater, I appreciate having a hearty side that's flavorful and gives the bread dressing a run for its money. Generously grease a 9-inch springform pan* and dust it with almond meal to prevent sticking. Use a whisk to mix well. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry. Stir just until there are a few clumps remaining, then pour the mixture into your prepared 9-inch pan.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/strawberry-rhubarb-almond-cake/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Combine the strawberries and rhubarb on your prepared baking sheet. Drizzle with &frac14; cup maple syrup or honey and mix well. Arrange the mixture in an even layer on the sheet.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/strawberry-rhubarb-almond-cake/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place the cake on the middle rack and the strawberry-rhubarb mixture on the upper rack. Bake for about 40 to 45 minutes, until the cake is golden brown and the center is firm to the touch (it shouldn&#8217;t jiggle when you shimmy the pan). Toss the strawberry-rhubarb mixture every 15 minutes or so, and keep an eye on it in the last 10 minutes of baking\u2014it&#8217;s done when the strawberry and rhubarb are cooked through, tender and jammy. (If you used honey, watch the edges especially and pull the pan before they burn.)", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/strawberry-rhubarb-almond-cake/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place the cake on a wire rack to cool. This recipe is incredible. I have made it a dozen times, including for my own wedding, playing with different in-season fruit. A few variations worth noting: 1. Plums, topped with thyme and 2. Peaches. \r\n\r\nYou can also swap orange zest with lemon zest for more zing. \r\n\r\nI have tried reducing sweetness by cutting maple syrup, with mild success - but doesn't come out quite as moist so still need to figure out how to compensate (diluting MS in water?). I usually make it now with full maple syrup and reduce the amount for the fruit. \r\n\r\nAmazing go-to recipe. Wonderful for gluten free folks."}], "datePublished": "2015-05-09", "@id": "https://cookieandkate.com/strawberry-rhubarb-almond-cake/#recipe", "isPartOf": {"@id": Toss the broccoli with a spatula and arrange it in an even layer across the pan again. Sprinkle the Parmesan over the broccoli, then return the pan to the oven. Bake for 10 more minutes, or until the florets are turning deeply golden on the edges and the Parmesan is golden and bubbly.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/parmesan-roasted-broccoli-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Drizzle balsamic lightly over the broccoli and grate lemon zest on top, to taste. Sprinkle with a pinch of red pepper flakes and flaky salt. This side dish is best served warm, but you can store leftovers in the refrigerator for several days. Remove the quinoa from heat and let it rest, still covered, for 5 minutes. Uncover the pot, drain off any excess water and fluff the quinoa with a fork. If you have a mandoline and julienne peeler (this is a pain), use the mandoline to julienne the beet and use a julienne peeler to julienne the carrot, then chop the ribbons into small pieces using a sharp chef&#8217;s knife.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/raw-beet-salad-with-carrot-quinoa-spinach/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To prepare the vinaigrette: Whisk together all of the ingredients until emulsified.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/raw-beet-salad-with-carrot-quinoa-spinach/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To assemble the salad: In your large serving bowl, combine the toasted almonds/pepitas, cooked edamame, prepared beet(s) and/or carrot, roughly chopped spinach/arugula (see note above about leftovers), cubed avocado and cooked quinoa.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/raw-beet-salad-with-carrot-quinoa-spinach/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Finally, drizzle dressing over the mixture (you might not need all of it) and gently toss to combine. This hearty vegetarian stew is full of irresistible fresh flavor. It's vegan, too, as long as you don't top it with cheese. Recipe yields 6 bowls or 8 cups of soup.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "Pasta e Fagioli (Italian Pasta and Beans)", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2020/01/best-pasta-e-fagioli-recipe-3-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2020/01/best-pasta-e-fagioli-recipe-3-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2020/01/best-pasta-e-fagioli-recipe-3-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2020/01/best-pasta-e-fagioli-recipe-3.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/pasta-e-fagioli-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["4 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, divided", "1 medium-to-large yellow onion, finely chopped", "2 carrots, scrubbed clean, finely chopped", "2 ribs celery, finely chopped", "&frac34; teaspoon fine sea salt, divided", "Freshly ground black pepper, to taste", "4 cloves garlic, pressed or minced", "1 can (15 ounces) crushed tomatoes*", "4 cups vegetable broth", "3 cups water", "2 bay leaves", "1 teaspoon dried oregano", "&frac14; teaspoon red pepper flakes, omit if sensitive to spice", "2 cans (15 ounces each) cannellini beans, Great Northern beans, or chickpeas, rinsed and drained (or 3 cups cooked beans)", "1 cup (about 4 ounces) cavatelli, ditalini, elbow or small shell pasta of choice", "2 cups chopped Tuscan kale (tough ribs removed first), or chard or collard greens", "&frac14; cup finely chopped Italian parsley", "1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice (about &frac12; medium lemon)", "Optional garnishes: Additional chopped parsley, black pepper, grated Parmesan cheese or light drizzle of olive oil"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large Dutch oven or soup pot over medium heat, warm 3 tablespoons of the olive oil until shimmering. Add the chopped onion, carrot, celery, &frac12; teaspoon of the salt, and about 10 twists of black pepper. Cook, stirring often, until the vegetables have softened and the onions are turning translucent, about 6 to 10 minutes.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/pasta-e-fagioli-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the garlic and cook, stirring constantly, until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add the tomatoes, stir, and cook until the tomatoes are bubbling all over. Add the broth, water, bay leaves, oregano, and red pepper flakes.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/pasta-e-fagioli-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Raise the heat to medium-high and bring the mixture to a simmer. Cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, and reducing the heat as necessary to maintain a gentle simmer.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/pasta-e-fagioli-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Use a heat-safe measuring cup to transfer about 1 &frac12; cups of the soup (avoiding the bay leaves) to a blender. Add about &frac34; cup of the drained beans. Securely fasten the lid and blend until completely smooth, being careful to avoid hot steam escaping from the lid. Pour the blended mixture back into the soup.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/pasta-e-fagioli-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the remaining beans, pasta, kale and parsley to the simmering soup. Continue cooking, stirring often to prevent the pasta from sticking to the bottom of the pot, for about 20 minutes, or until the pasta and greens are pleasantly tender.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/pasta-e-fagioli-recipe/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove the pot from the heat, then remove and discard the bay leaves. Stir in the lemon juice, the remaining tablespoon of olive oil, and remaining &frac14; teaspoon salt. Taste and season with more salt (I usually add another &frac14; teaspoon) and pepper until the flavors really sing. Garnish bowls of soup as desired, and serve.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/pasta-e-fagioli-recipe/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Leftovers taste even better the next day. Allow leftover soup to cool to room temperature, then cover and refrigerate for up to 5 days. Cook with me!", "sameAs": ["https://cookieandkate.com/about/"]}, {"@context": "https://schema.org/", "@type": "Recipe", "name": "Quinoa Vegetable Soup", "description": "This healthy homemade vegetable soup recipe is full of veggies, kale and quinoa. It's easy to make and good for you, too! This soup makes great leftovers. It's gluten free and vegan, as long as you don't top it with optional Parmesan cheese. Recipe yields 4 to 6 servings of soup.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "quinoa vegetable soup, fall, winter", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2015/03/quinoa-vegetable-soup-recipe-4-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2015/03/quinoa-vegetable-soup-recipe-4-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2015/03/quinoa-vegetable-soup-recipe-4-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2015/03/quinoa-vegetable-soup-recipe-4.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/quinoa-vegetable-soup-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["3 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil", "1 medium yellow or white onion, chopped", "3 carrots, peeled and chopped", "2 celery stalks, chopped", "1 to 2 cups chopped seasonal vegetables, like zucchini, yellow squash, bell pepper, sweet potatoes or butternut squash", "6 garlic cloves, pressed or minced", "&frac12; teaspoon dried thyme", "1 large can (28 ounces) diced tomatoes", "Scant 1 cup quinoa, rinsed well in a fine mesh colander (use less for a lighter, more broth-y soup)", "4 cups (32 ounces) vegetable broth", "2 cups water", "1 teaspoon salt, more to taste", "2 bay leaves", "Pinch red pepper flakes", "Freshly ground black pepper", "1 can (15 ounces) great northern beans or chickpeas, rinsed and drained", "1 cup or more chopped fresh kale or collard greens, tough ribs removed", "1 to 2 teaspoons lemon juice, to taste", "Optional garnish: freshly grated Parmesan cheese"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Warm the olive oil in a large Dutch oven or soup pot over medium heat. Once the oil is shimmering, add the chopped onion, carrot, celery, seasonal vegetables and a pinch of salt. Cook, stirring often, until the onion has softened and is turning translucent, about 6 to 8 minutes.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/quinoa-vegetable-soup-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the garlic and thyme. Cook until fragrant while stirring frequently, about 1 minute. Pour in the diced tomatoes with their juices and cook for a few more minutes, stirring often.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/quinoa-vegetable-soup-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour in the quinoa, broth and the water. Add 1 teaspoon salt, 2 bay leaves and a pinch of red pepper flakes. Season generously with freshly ground black pepper. Raise heat and bring the mixture to a boil, then partially cover the pot and reduce heat to maintain a gentle simmer.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/quinoa-vegetable-soup-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cook for 25 minutes, then remove the lid and add the beans and the chopped greens. Continue simmering for 5 minutes or more, until the greens have softened to your liking.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/quinoa-vegetable-soup-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove the pot from heat, then remove the bay leaves. Stir in 1 teaspoon lemon juice. Taste and season with more salt, pepper and/or lemon juice until the flavors really sing. (You might need up to &frac12; teaspoon more salt, depending on your vegetable broth and your personal preferences.) Recipe yields 2 small lava cakes, perfect for 2 people (or 4 people if you're willing to share).", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "chocolate lava cake", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2021/02/mini-chocolate-lava-cake-recipe-3-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2021/02/mini-chocolate-lava-cake-recipe-3-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2021/02/mini-chocolate-lava-cake-recipe-3-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2021/02/mini-chocolate-lava-cake-recipe-3.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/mini-lava-cakes-for-two/", "recipeIngredient": ["3 tablespoons unsalted butter, plus more for greasing the tin", "Cocoa powder or additional flour, for dusting the tin", "&#8531; cup quality bittersweet or semisweet chocolate chips or 2 ounces chocolate, chopped into small pieces", "2 large eggs (we&#8217;ll use 1 yolk and 1 full egg)", "2 tablespoons sugar", "&frac14; teaspoon vanilla extract", "Pinch of salt", "1 teaspoon flour (whole wheat, all purpose or gluten-free flour blend)", "Suggested garnishes: Powdered sugar, strawberry or vanilla ice cream, fresh sliced strawberries or whole raspberries"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 450 degrees Fahrenheit, assuming you will be baking these lava cakes right away (see notes for make-ahead option).", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/mini-lava-cakes-for-two/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Prepare your muffin tin by heavily buttering only two of the cups (one on the center outside edge, the other on the opposite). See photos for reference and be sure to coat them well. Then sprinkle some cocoa powder into the buttered cups. Turn and tap the tin over the sink to lightly coat the insides of the cups with the powder. Set the tin aside.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/mini-lava-cakes-for-two/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place the butter in a medium heat-safe mixing bowl and melt it in the microwave (alternately, gently melt it over low heat on the stove and then remove it from the heat). Add the chocolate to the bowl and stir until melted (if the chocolate won&#8217;t melt on its own, gently warm the mixture in the microwave in 30-second intervals, stirring after each, or over very low heat on the stovetop). Set aside.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/mini-lava-cakes-for-two/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Crack one egg and pour the egg white into a bowl for later use* or discard it. Pour the yolk into another medium-to-large mixing bowl. Crack the second egg into the yolk bowl (both the white and the yolk). Add the sugar, vanilla and salt. Beat the mixture with a whisk until foamy and pale, about 1 to 2 minutes.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/mini-lava-cakes-for-two/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour the egg mixture into the chocolate mixture. Add the flour. Whisk until the mixture is fully combined.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/mini-lava-cakes-for-two/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Divide the mixture between the two prepared muffin cups. You can fill them all the way to the top (you should have just enough mixture to fill them, but if you have extra, discard it).", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/mini-lava-cakes-for-two/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for 5 minutes, until the cakes have risen from their cups but still jiggle in the center just a bit. Place the muffin tin on a heat-safe surface and let the cakes cool for 1 minute.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/mini-lava-cakes-for-two/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In the meantime, find two dessert plates or appetizer plates with raised rims. Here&#8217;s the slightly tricky part\u2014place the plates upside down over each of the cakes. While wearing oven mitts, securely grab both plates and the tin itself with both hands. Flip the whole thing and place the plate sides down on the counter. Gently lift up the tin and the lava cakes should release without trouble.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/mini-lava-cakes-for-two/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Garnish as desired (if using powdered sugar, place a small spoonful in a fine-mesh sieve and sprinkle the sieve over the plates). Serve at once! Mix in the melted butter and yogurt. Whisk until blended and pour all of the dressing over the chickpea mixture. It's loaded with fresh broccoli, and creamy thanks to a potato and cheddar cheese (no cream, no flour!). Recipe yields about 10 cups (quite a bit) and is easily halved.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "vegetarian broccoli cheddar soup", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2020/03/broccoli-cheese-soup-recipe-3-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2020/03/broccoli-cheese-soup-recipe-3-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2020/03/broccoli-cheese-soup-recipe-3-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2020/03/broccoli-cheese-soup-recipe-3.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/broccoli-cheese-soup-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["3 tablespoons unsalted butter", "2 medium yellow onions, coarsely chopped", "6 garlic cloves, smashed and peeled", "\u00bd teaspoon red pepper flakes (reduce or omit if sensitive to spice)", "1 &frac14; teaspoon fine sea salt, divided, to taste", "Freshly ground black pepper, to taste", "2 pounds broccoli with stalks (3 large or 4 medium)", "1 large (about 12 ounces) russet potato, peeled and cut into 1 to 2-inch chunks", "6 cups water", "4 to 8 ounces grated sharp cheddar cheese, depending on your mood", "Thinly sliced chives or green onions, for garnish (optional)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Melt the butter in a large Dutch oven or soup pot over medium-low heat. Add the onion, garlic, red pepper flakes, &frac14; teaspoon of the salt, and about 10 twists of black pepper.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/broccoli-cheese-soup-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Stir to combine, then cover the pot and cook, stirring occasionally, until the onions have softened and are just starting to turn golden, about 8 to 10 minutes.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/broccoli-cheese-soup-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Meanwhile, slice off and discard the rough bottom ends of broccoli stalks. Use a vegetable peeler to peel off the tough outer skin on the stalks, then discard those bits. Slice the stalks off and cut them into pieces about 1 to 2-inches big. Set aside.\u00a0", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/broccoli-cheese-soup-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Working with the broccoli tops now, cut as closely to the base of the florets as you can. Slice any remaining stalks into chunks to match to the rest. Reserve the broccoli florets\u2014we&#8217;ll use them in a bit.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/broccoli-cheese-soup-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the chunks of broccoli stalk and potato to the pot and stir. Pour in 6 cups water and the remaining 1 teaspoon salt. Raise the heat to high and bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to medium-low and cover the pot.\u00a0", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/broccoli-cheese-soup-recipe/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Simmer until the broccoli stalks and potatoes are tender throughout and easily split apart when pierced with a fork, about 20-25 minutes. Meanwhile, chop the reserved florets into small pieces (I chop them all in one direction, then turn the cutting board and chop again).\u00a0", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/broccoli-cheese-soup-recipe/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Once the potato and stalks are tender, add half of the florets to pot, stir, cover, and cook until they&#8217;re bright green, about 3 to 5 minutes. Remove the pot from the heat. Working in a couple of batches (never fill your blender past the maximum fill line or it could explode!), carefully transfer several cups of the mixture\u2014both the liquid and solids\u2014to your stand blender. Blend until completely smooth, then transfer the mixture to a heat-proof vessel temporarily as you blend the rest. Alternatively, use an immersion blender (it just won&#8217;t be as lusciously creamy). Return the pur\u00e9e to the pot.\u00a0", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/broccoli-cheese-soup-recipe/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Return the pot to medium heat and add the remaining florets. Cover the pot and cook until they&#8217;re bright green and easily pierced through by a fork, another 4 to 7 minutes. Add almost all 4 ounces of the grated cheddar cheese (reserve a small handful for garnish) and stir until smooth. Carefully taste (it&#8217;s hot) and stir in more cheese if you&#8217;d like more indulgent flavor/creamy texture, more salt for more overall flavor, and/or more black pepper for kick.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/broccoli-cheese-soup-recipe/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Divide the soup into bowls and top with a sprinkle of cheese, plus some thinly sliced chives and/or red pepper flakes, if desired. Leftover soup keeps well in the refrigerator for up to 4 days (though the color darkens a bit with time). I haven&#8217;t tried freezing this soup but suspect it will work fine\u2014please let us know in the comments if you do.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/broccoli-cheese-soup-recipe/#instruction-step-9"}], "prepTime": "PT15M", "cookTime": "PT50M", "totalTime": "PT1H5M", "recipeYield": ["6", "6 bowls"], "recipeCategory": "Soup", "cookingMethod": "Blended", "recipeCuisine": "American", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "359", "ratingValue": "4.9"}, "nutrition": {"servingSize": "1 bowl of soup from batch made with 4 ounces cheddar", "calories": "243 calories", "sugarContent": "4.6 g", "sodiumContent": "620.6 mg", "fatContent": "12.7 g", "saturatedFatContent": "7.2 g", "transFatContent": "0.2 g", "carbohydrateContent": "25.4 g", "fiberContent": "5.4 g", "proteinContent": "10.5 g", "cholesterolContent": "34 mg", "@type": "nutritionInformation"}, "video": {"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "VideoObject", "name": "\u201dBrocoli", "description": "\u201dWatch", "contentUrl": "https://content.jwplatform.com/videos/&rdquo;gSt8FO7J&rdquo;.mp4", "thumbnailUrl": ["https://content.jwplatform.com/thumbs/&rdquo;gSt8FO7J&rdquo;-720.jpg"], "uploadDate": "1970-01-01T00:00:00+00:00"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cheryl Bishell"}, "datePublished": "2024-09-24", "reviewBody": "This soup was SO delicious,using every part of the broccoli was great, and creaminess without cream was a bonus. Really great.  It takes some time to make, but well worth it, especially if you have lots of broccoli stalks. I didn't measure everything exactly, because I don't have a scale in my kitchen.  LOTS of onion, garlic and pepper really add to the flavor.  I boiled the potatoes and stalks in 3 cups of water.  Then I saut\u00e9ed the the onions and garlic in a pot large enough to hold everything. I blended the onions and garlic with some of the vegetable stock and then returned it to the pot.  After blending the broccoli and potatoes, I would recommend heating it over a double boiler when melting the cheese.  At the end I steamed the flowerets in another cup of water and added it to the batch.  Thus you can add more water when reheating if you like.  I personally enjoyed it really thick and creamy.  Mil Gracias. Having a pressure cooker and liking my soup completely smooth, it was really quick.  I fried the onions and garlic (I don't like pepper flakes) in the pressure cooker, then added everything else except the cheese.  Also added a chicken stock cube and cooked it all under  high pressure for a few minutes.  In England, recipes don't use \"cups\" so it's 48 fluid ounces water.  Once the pressure was off I stirred in the cheese, and used half parmesan and half cheddar and plenty of freshly ground black pepper.  Very good. One of the comments suggested a sweet potato which sounds even better so I will try that next time.  We have wild chives in the garden so I chopped them finely and sprinkled them over to garnish."}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Suman"}, "datePublished": "2025-02-12", "reviewBody": "\"Cut as closely to the florets as you possibly can \", that and adding half the florets to the base and half later. Cook with me!", "sameAs": ["https://cookieandkate.com/about/"]}, {"@context": "https://schema.org/", "@type": "Recipe", "name": "Spicy Grapefruit Margaritas", "description": "These sweet and spicy grapefruit margaritas are so refreshing! You can leave out the jalape\u00f1o if you want a basic, fresh grapefruit margarita, but I love the kick that the pepper provides. Recipe below yields one drink, so multiply as necessary.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2015/03/spicy-grapefruit-margaritas-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2015/03/spicy-grapefruit-margaritas-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2015/03/spicy-grapefruit-margaritas-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2015/03/spicy-grapefruit-margaritas.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/spicy-grapefruit-margarita-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 ounce fresh lime juice (about 1 large lime, juiced)", "1 teaspoon light agave nectar or 2 teaspoons simple syrup", "1 thinly sliced jalape\u00f1o round (&#8539;th to &frac14;th inch wide, a little goes a long way!)", "2 ounces grapefruit juice (about &frac12; large grapefruit, juiced)", "1 &frac12; ounces 100% agave blanco/silver or reposado tequila", "3 parts kosher salt", "1 part ancho chili powder or regular chili powder", "Lime wedges", "Small grapefruit wedges for garnish, optional"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "First, prepare your glasses. Mix together the salt and chili on a small, rimmed plate. Run a lime wedge around the outer top edge of your glasses, then roll the edges in the chili-salt so it sticks. Place one big ice cube or a few smaller ice cubes in each glass.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/spicy-grapefruit-margarita-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a cocktail shaker or mason jar, add the lime juice, agave nectar and jalape\u00f1o slice. Use a muddler to crush the jalape\u00f1o. Pour in the grapefruit juice and tequila, then top off the shaker with ice. Sift through the lentils with your fingers to make sure you didn&#8217;t miss anything. Then, rinse your lentils under running water until the water runs clear. Once your timer has gone off, use a fork to scoop out a few lentils and test for doneness (careful, they&#8217;re hot). Your lentils are done when they are pleasantly tender throughout (not mushy or falling apart) and taste nicely earthy (undercooked lentils tend to taste somewhat metallic). If your lentils aren&#8217;t fully cooked yet, retest every 1 to 2 minutes until they are.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/perfect-lentils-recipe/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Once cooked, immediately strain off all the excess water. If you&#8217;re serving them on their own or as an element in a salad, you might want to stir in 1 to 2 teaspoons olive oil to prevent sticking and add some luxurious flavor. I mean tiny, like baluga lentils. They don't match descriptions of lentils that I've read about or seen in the market, and I still don't know what kind they are. They are a product of a family farm in Nebraska. The bag said to soak the lentils and gave two methods, but they gave no cooking time. Lentils do not need soaking, so I found this to be very strange. In Googling lentil recipes, I found this one. Since I am a long-term blog subscriber, I knew it would be perfect. I followed her instructions to a T. The lentils were fully cooked in 18 minutes. Wow! I taste tested, and they had fantastic flavor! Definitely a keeper. My plan was to make a cold lentil-veggie salad, Mideast style (Persian cucumbers, green onions, red and yellow bell pepper, celery, and Italian parsley). I crushed the cooked garlic like Kate said to do and to it added kalamata olive oil, fresh minced garlic, ground sumac, Mediterranean oregano, and ground ajwain (wild thyme, which helps prevent \"music\") for the dressing. The salad was fabulous! I took it and two other salads for fellow volunteers, and those who were venturous enough to try it liked it. Thank you, Kate, for the detailed instructions on cooking all types of lentils. The cheesy quinoa filling develops an irresistible crispy top in the oven. Make it for your holiday dinner or serve it on a relaxed weeknight at home. Recipe yields 4 stuffed squash halves.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "vegetarian stuffed acorn squash", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/12/vegetarian-stuffed-acorn-squash-recipe-4-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/12/vegetarian-stuffed-acorn-squash-recipe-4-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/12/vegetarian-stuffed-acorn-squash-recipe-4-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/12/vegetarian-stuffed-acorn-squash-recipe-4.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegetarian-stuffed-acorn-squash-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["2 medium acorn squash", "2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, divided", "&frac12; teaspoon fine sea salt, divided", "&frac12; cup quinoa, rinsed", "1 cup water", "&frac14; cup dried cranberries", "&frac14;\u00a0cup raw pepitas (hulled pumpkin seeds)", "&frac14;\u00a0cup chopped green onion", "&frac14;\u00a0cup chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley, plus 1 tablespoon for garnish", "1 clove garlic, pressed or minced", "1 tablespoon lemon juice", "&frac34; cup grated Parmesan cheese", "&frac12;\u00a0cup crumbled goat cheese or feta"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit and line a large, rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper for easy clean-up.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegetarian-stuffed-acorn-squash-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To prepare the squash, use a sharp chef&#8217;s knife to slice through it from the tip to the stem. I find it easiest to pierce the squash in the center along a depression line, then cut through the tip, and finish by slicing through the top portion just next to the stem. Use a large spoon to scoop out the seeds and stringy bits inside, and discard those pieces.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegetarian-stuffed-acorn-squash-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place the squash halves cut side up on the parchment-lined pan. Drizzle 1 tablespoon of the olive oil over the squash, and sprinkle with &frac14; teaspoon of the salt. Rub the oil into the cut sides of the squash, then turn them over so the cut sides are against the pan. Bake until the squash flesh is easily pierced through by a fork, about 30 to 45 minutes. Leave the oven on.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegetarian-stuffed-acorn-squash-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Meanwhile, cook the quinoa: In a medium saucepan, combine the rinsed quinoa and water.\u00a0Bring the mixture to a boil over medium-high heat, then reduce the heat as necessary to maintain a gentle simmer. Simmer, uncovered, until all of the water is absorbed, 12 to 18 minutes. Remove the pot from the heat and stir in the cranberries. Cover, and let the mixture steam for 5 minutes. Uncover and fluff the quinoa with a fork.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegetarian-stuffed-acorn-squash-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a medium skillet, toast the pepitas over medium heat, stirring frequently, until the pepitas are turning golden on the edges and making little popping noises, about 4 to 5 minutes. Set aside.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegetarian-stuffed-acorn-squash-recipe/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour the fluffed quinoa mixture into a medium mixing bowl. Add the toasted pepitas, chopped green onion, parsley, garlic, lemon juice, the remaining &frac14; teaspoon salt, and the remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil. Stir until the ingredients are evenly distributed. Taste and add additional salt, if necessary.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegetarian-stuffed-acorn-squash-recipe/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "If the mixture is very hot, let it cool for a few minutes before adding the Parmesan cheese and goat cheese. Divide the mixture evenly between the squash halves with a large spoon. Grease a 10-inch cast iron skillet or 9&#8243; pie pan with olive oil or cooking spray. In a mixing bowl, stir together the almond meal, garlic, thyme, salt and pepper. Pour in the olive oil and water and stir until the mixture is thoroughly combined.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/arugula-and-cremini-quiche-with-gluten-free-almond-meal-crust/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Press the dough into your prepared skillet/pan until it is evenly dispersed across the bottom and at least 1 &frac14; inch up the sides. Bake until the crust is lightly golden and firm to the touch, about 15 to 20 minutes.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/arugula-and-cremini-quiche-with-gluten-free-almond-meal-crust/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large skillet over medium heat, warm enough olive oil to lightly coat the pan. Cook the mushrooms with a dash of salt, stirring often, until tender. Toss in the arugula and let it wilt, while stirring, about 30 seconds. Transfer the mixture to a plate to cool.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/arugula-and-cremini-quiche-with-gluten-free-almond-meal-crust/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a mixing bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, salt and red pepper. Let the quiche cool for 5 to 10 minutes before slicing with a sharp knife. We had everything on hand except goat cheese, so put in just a little Swiss and a sprinkle of grated parm over the top. Added a bit of garlic powder and thyme since those were supposed to be in the crust. All the ingredients in this quiche are actually good for fighting gout so I will be getting more arugula soon and we\u2019ll enjoy it with the almond meal crust.
