First, trim the stalk, then find a natural separation, then cut and turn and find another natural separation, and ultimately the florets should be about 2 to 3 inches wide and 1 inch thick or less. You might need to halve the really big florets to make this work.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/smashed-broccoli-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place the broccoli florets on the prepared baking sheet. Drizzle the olive oil over the broccoli and sprinkle with the salt, garlic powder and onion powder. Toss until evenly coated (if you don\u2019t have enough oil to lightly coat it all, add another small splash). Arrange the broccoli in an even layer across the baking sheet.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/smashed-broccoli-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Roast the broccoli for 18 to 21 minutes, until the stems are easily pierced by a fork, then place it on a stable heat-safe surface. Use a sturdy, flat-bottomed jar or glass to smash each piece of broccoli, to the point that the stems splay out a bit. It works best to smash and then slide the jar forward to release the broccoli.\u00a0", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/smashed-broccoli-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Once each floret has been smashed, arrange them evenly across the pan again. Then add the rest of the milk and stir to combine.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/overnight-oats-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Top with your fruit of choice. In a medium bowl, toss the oats, pistachios, almonds, sunflower seeds, sesame seeds, salt, and cayenne pepper. Stir in the beaten egg white, oil, and honey until well blended. Transfer mixture to a rimmed baking sheet and bake, stirring halfway, until golden, about 16-19 minutes. Let the granola cool on the baking sheet.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/strawberry-kale-salad-with-nutty-granola-croutons/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To make the dressing: In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice, mustard, honey and salt until well blended. Chop the kale leaves into small, bite-sized pieces. Transfer the chopped kale to a big salad bowl. Sprinkle a pinch of salt over the kale and massage the leaves with your hands by lightly scrunching big handfuls at a time, until the leaves are darker in color and fragrant.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/strawberry-kale-salad-with-nutty-granola-croutons/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To assemble the salad: Drizzle in the salad dressing (you might not need all of it) and toss well, until all of the kale is lightly coated in dressing. Add the sliced strawberries and chopped radishes, then use a fork to crumble the goat cheese over the salad. For the best flavor, let the salad rest for 15 minutes before serving (this gives the dressing time to soak into the kale).", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/strawberry-kale-salad-with-nutty-granola-croutons/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Top with granola just before serving to preserve its crunch (if you intend to have leftovers, add granola to individual servings and store it separately from the salad). This salad will keep well covered in the refrigerator for up to 2 days and the granola will keep in an air-tight freezer bag in the freezer for several months. It's full of caramelized sweet potatoes, red bell pepper, black beans, feta and optional-but-recommended cilantro. This frittata yields 6 medium slices of frittata (as shown), or 4 large or 8 small.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2014/10/sweet-potato-red-pepper-feta-frittata-1-2-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2014/10/sweet-potato-red-pepper-feta-frittata-1-2-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2014/10/sweet-potato-red-pepper-feta-frittata-1-2-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2014/10/sweet-potato-red-pepper-feta-frittata-1-2.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/sweet-potato-red-pepper-feta-frittata/", "recipeIngredient": ["8 eggs", "&frac12; cup milk", "2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro leaves (optional)", "2 cloves garlic, pressed or minced", "&frac34; teaspoon fine salt, divided", "Freshly ground black pepper", "1 medium sweet potato (&frac34; pound or so), peeled and chopped into &frac14;-inch cubes", "1 medium red bell pepper, ribbed, seeded and chopped into &frac14;-inch pieces", "1 tablespoon olive oil", "1 teaspoon ground cumin", "&frac12; teaspoon smoked paprika", "&#8532; cup cooked black beans, rinsed and drained", "&#8531; to &frac12; cup crumbled feta (2 to 3 ounces)", "Avocado, diced", "Chopped fresh cilantro", "Jarred salsa verde", "Hot sauce", "Optional: pickled jalape\u00f1os"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit. In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, cilantro, garlic, &frac14; teaspoon salt and several twists of freshly ground black pepper.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/sweet-potato-red-pepper-feta-frittata/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a 10-inch oven-safe saut\u00e9 pan or well-seasoned cast iron skillet, warm the olive oil over medium heat. Add the chopped sweet potatoes and red pepper and toss to coat, then sprinkle with cumin, smoked paprika and &frac12; teaspoon salt and stir. Once the pan is sizzling, cover the pan and reduce heat slightly to avoid burning the contents. Cook until the sweet potato is tender and cooked through, stirring occasionally, about 8 minutes.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/sweet-potato-red-pepper-feta-frittata/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Uncover the pan, raise the heat back to medium and cook until the excess moisture has evaporated and the sweet potatoes are caramelizing on the edges, about 5 to 10 minutes (add another little splash of olive oil if the potatoes start sticking to the pan).", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/sweet-potato-red-pepper-feta-frittata/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Turn the heat down to low. Arrange the sweet potatoes and peppers in an even layer in the bottom of the skillet. Sprinkle black beans over the vegetables in an even layer. Whisk the egg mixture one last time and pour it into the pan. Crumble the feta with your fingers or a fork over the top of the frittata. Put the pan in the oven and bake until you can shake the pan (wear oven mitts!) and see that the middle is just barely set, about 12 to 18 minutes.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/sweet-potato-red-pepper-feta-frittata/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Set the frittata aside for a few minutes before slicing it. Recipe yields 6 side servings.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "couscous salad", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2012/07/mediterranean-couscous-salad-recipe-3-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2012/07/mediterranean-couscous-salad-recipe-3-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2012/07/mediterranean-couscous-salad-recipe-3-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2012/07/mediterranean-couscous-salad-recipe-3.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/mediterranean-couscous-salad-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 &#8531; cup whole wheat Israeli couscous (or any other small pasta shape, you\u2019ll need about 3 cups cooked)", "&#8531; cup pine nuts", "&#8531; cup extra-virgin olive oil", "2 to 4 tablespoons lemon juice, to taste (from 1 to 2 lemons)", "1 large shallot, finely chopped (about &frac12; cup)", "2 cloves garlic, pressed or minced", "&frac12; teaspoon fine sea salt, to taste", "Freshly ground black pepper, to taste", "1 can (15 ounces) chickpeas, rinsed and drained, or 1 &frac12; cups cooked chickpeas", "1 pint grape or cherry tomatoes, quartered", "4 ounces feta cheese, crumbled (about 1 cup)", "&#8531; cup pitted and thinly sliced Kalamata olives", "1 medium zucchini, sliced into super thin rounds", "1 small yellow squash, sliced into super thin rounds", "&#8531; cup (&#8532; ounce) chopped fresh basil or flat-leaf parsley"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cook the couscous until al dente, according to package directions. This salad features goat cheese, pistachios and arugula with a zippy Dijon dressing. Recipe yields 4 to 6 side servings.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "roasted beet salad with greens", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2021/02/roasted-beet-arugula-salad-recipe-1-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2021/02/roasted-beet-arugula-salad-recipe-1-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2021/02/roasted-beet-arugula-salad-recipe-1-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2021/02/roasted-beet-arugula-salad-recipe-1.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/roasted-beet-salad-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 \u00bd\u00a0pounds beets (about\u00a03\u00a0large or\u00a05\u00a0small-to-medium)", "1 tablespoon\u00a0extra-virgin olive oil", "\u00bc teaspoon\u00a0fine salt, to taste", "5 ounces (5\u00a0heaping cups) arugula", "4 ounces\u00a0goat cheese, crumbled", "&#8531; cup shelled toasted and salted pistachios, chopped, or &frac12; cup pepitas (green pumpkin seeds), toasted*", "4 medium radishes, thinly sliced and roughly chopped (about &frac12; cup)", "&#8531; cup chopped green onion", "\u00bc cup extra-virgin olive oil", "2 tablespoons sherry vinegar or red wine vinegar", "1 tablespoon honey\u00a0", "1 tablespoon Dijon mustard", "\u00bc teaspoon fine sea salt", "Freshly ground black pepper, to taste"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To roast the beets: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit and line a large, rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper for easy clean-up. Scrub the beets well with a vegetable brush under running water (no need to peel them at any point).", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/roasted-beet-salad-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a sharp chef&#8217;s knife, slice off the base of each beet to create a flat surface, and slice off the skinny pointy ends as well. Place each beet with its flat side against the cutting board and slice the beets in half, then slice the beets into wedges of even thickness, about &frac12; to &frac34;-inch thick on the widest edge.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/roasted-beet-salad-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place the beet wedges on the prepared baking sheet. Drizzle the beets with the olive oil and sprinkle with the salt. Toss until the beets are evenly coated, then arrange them in a single layer across the pan.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/roasted-beet-salad-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Roast for 35 to 40 minutes, tossing halfway, until you&#8217;re able to pierce through the beets with a fork with light pressure.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/roasted-beet-salad-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Meanwhile, prep the remaining ingredients and whisk together the dressing: In a liquid measuring cup or bowl, combine the olive oil, vinegar, honey, mustard and salt. Season generously with black pepper and whisk until fully blended. Taste, and add more pepper to make it nicely peppery. Set aside.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/roasted-beet-salad-recipe/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To assemble the salad, place the arugula in a large serving bowl or platter. Scatter the roasted beets on top, followed by the crumbled goat cheese, chopped pistachios, radishes and green onion.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/roasted-beet-salad-recipe/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "When you&#8217;re ready to serve, drizzle the dressing over the salad (you might not need all of it) and gently toss to coat. If you&#8217;re planning for leftovers, dress individual servings as needed instead, and store the salad and dressing separately in the fridge for up to 4 days.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/roasted-beet-salad-recipe/#instruction-step-7"}], "prepTime": "PT20M", "cookTime": "PT40M", "totalTime": "PT1H", "recipeYield": ["4", "4 to 6 servings"], "recipeCategory": "Salad", "cookingMethod": "Various", "recipeCuisine": "French", "suitableForDiet": "VegetarianDiet", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "78", "ratingValue": "4.9"}, "nutrition": {"servingSize": "1 of 4 servings (assuming all salad dressing is used)", "calories": "390 calories", "sugarContent": "17.6 g", "sodiumContent": "708.3 mg", "fatContent": "28.7 g", "saturatedFatContent": "7.3 g", "transFatContent": "0 g", "carbohydrateContent": "25.5 g", "fiberContent": "6.7 g", "proteinContent": "11.3 g", "cholesterolContent": "13.1 mg", "@type": "nutritionInformation"}, "video": {"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "VideoObject", "name": "\u201dRoasted", "description": "\u201dWatch", "contentUrl": "https://content.jwplatform.com/videos/&rdquo;oEGcEheQ&rdquo;.mp4", "thumbnailUrl": ["https://content.jwplatform.com/thumbs/&rdquo;oEGcEheQ&rdquo;-720.jpg"], "uploadDate": "1970-01-01T00:00:00+00:00"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "christine travers"}, "datePublished": "2025-02-15", "reviewBody": "Lovely salad but I've taken to roasting beets whole, unpeeled, without foil (you can use unbleached parchment instead). Recipe yields 6 to 8 servings.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "Brussels sprout gratin, Brussels sprout casserole", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2015/01/brussels-sprout-quinoa-gratin-recipe-3-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2015/01/brussels-sprout-quinoa-gratin-recipe-3-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2015/01/brussels-sprout-quinoa-gratin-recipe-3-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2015/01/brussels-sprout-quinoa-gratin-recipe-3.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/brussels-sprout-quinoa-gratin/", "recipeIngredient": ["2 cups vegetable broth or water", "1 cup quinoa (any color), rinsed under running water in a mesh sieve for a minute and drained", "1 pound Brussels sprouts, small sprouts halved and large sprouts quartered", "1 to 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil", "1 tablespoon dried oregano", "1 &frac12; teaspoons dried thyme", "&frac34; teaspoon salt", "&frac12; teaspoon freshly ground black pepper", "&#8539; teaspoon ground nutmeg", "Pinch red pepper flakes, optional", "4 ounces (about 1 &frac12; cups) grated Gruy\u00e8re cheese", "2 ounces (about &frac34; cup) grated Fontina cheese", "1 cup low-fat milk (cow&#8217;s milk tastes best but unsweetened plain almond milk works, too)", "&frac14; cup grated Parmesan cheese", "&frac12; tablespoon butter or extra-virgin olive oil", "1 teaspoon pressed or minced garlic", "1 slice whole wheat bread or gluten-free bread, torn into pieces and processed into crumbs in a food processor or blender"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit. Bring the vegetable broth or water to boil in a heavy-bottomed pot. Add the quinoa, cover, reduce heat to low and simmer for 17 to 20 minutes, or until all of the liquid is absorbed. Cover and set aside.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/brussels-sprout-quinoa-gratin/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Toss the prepared Brussels sprouts with enough olive oil to lightly coat the sprouts on all sides. Arrange in a single layer on a rimmed baking sheet and bake for about 12 to 18 minutes, until they&#8217;re starting to caramelize on the edges.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/brussels-sprout-quinoa-gratin/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Reduce the oven heat to 350 degrees. Stir the dried oregano, thyme, salt, pepper, nutmeg and red pepper flakes into the quinoa. Then stir in the cheese until it&#8217;s all melted. Stir in the milk until the cheese and milk are evenly incorporated into the quinoa. Discard any burnt single Brussels sprout leaves on the pan, then stir the roasted sprouts into the quinoa. Transfer the mixture to an 8 by 8-inch square baking dish and sprinkle evenly with grated Parmesan.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/brussels-sprout-quinoa-gratin/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Melt the butter in a medium-sized pan over medium heat. Let the rice steam for 10 minutes. Fabulous!"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sarah Carroll"}, "datePublished": "2021-10-23", "reviewBody": "I've been making baked apples since I was a kid, and this preparation technique with the little apple \"hat\" was a real improvement! I have also never thought to add oats - yum! I used raisins instead of nuts because that's what I have always put in my baked apples and it was delicious. These go best with vanilla ice cream, but in a pinch I will take a couple tablespoons of half and half, add a tiny bit of vanilla (and maple syrup if the apple is a tart one) and drizzle it over the top of the apple. Not as good as ice cream, but certainly better than plain yogurt. Serve it in a bowl or small individual cups, as it's typically served in Mexico. Esquites are also called elote en vaso. Recipe yields 4 small side servings and is easily doubled for a crowd; if doubling, give the corn extra time in the pan to turn nicely golden.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "Mexican corn salad, elote en vaso, summer snack", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2021/05/mexican-corn-salad-recipe-3-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2021/05/mexican-corn-salad-recipe-3-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2021/05/mexican-corn-salad-recipe-3-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2021/05/mexican-corn-salad-recipe-3.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/esquites-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["2 tablespoons unsalted butter or extra-virgin olive oil", "3 &frac12; cups corn kernels (16 ounces frozen or from about 5 fresh cobs)", "&frac12; teaspoon fine salt", "2 medium cloves garlic, pressed or minced", "\u00bc cup mayonnaise*", "1 medium finely chopped jalape\u00f1o, optional", "1 tablespoon lime juice, plus extra lime wedges for garnish", "1 teaspoon chili powder, plus more for sprinkling", "Pinch of cayenne pepper (optional, for extra heat)", "\u00bc cup finely grated Cotija cheese**, plus more for sprinkling", "\u00bc cup finely chopped cilantro"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Melt the butter in a large skillet, preferably cast iron, over medium heat. Once melted, add the corn and the salt (if using frozen corn, no need to defrost first). Cook, stirring just every minute or so, until the corn is warmed through and turning golden on the edges, about 5 to 8 minutes (turn the heat down to low if the corn starts jumping out of the pan).\u00a0", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/esquites-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds, then remove the skillet from the heat. Let the corn cool for a few minutes, then transfer it to a medium mixing bowl.\u00a0", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/esquites-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the remaining ingredients to the bowl (the mayonnaise, optional jalape\u00f1o, lime juice, chili powder, optional cayenne, cheese and cilantro). Stir to combine. Season to taste with additional salt, if needed.\u00a0", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/esquites-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To serve, divide the mixture between small cups and garnish individual servings with a wedge of lime, perhaps a sprinkle of additional cheese and chili powder. Cook with me!", "sameAs": ["https://cookieandkate.com/about/"]}, {"@context": "https://schema.org/", "@type": "Recipe", "name": "Buckwheat Double Chocolate Cookies", "description": "This gluten-free double chocolate cookie recipe is made with buckwheat flour, which lends a delicious nutty flavor. These cookies totally taste like brownies. Note that you will need a stand mixer or electric hand mixer for this recipe! Recipe yields 30 small cookies (mine were a little bigger than they were supposed to be so I ended up with about 24).", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/09/gluten-free-double-chocolate-cookies-recipe-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/09/gluten-free-double-chocolate-cookies-recipe-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/09/gluten-free-double-chocolate-cookies-recipe-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/09/gluten-free-double-chocolate-cookies-recipe.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/gluten-free-double-chocolate-cookies/", "recipeIngredient": ["6 tablespoons unsalted butter", "12 ounces bittersweet chocolate (60\u201370% cacao mass)*, chopped (about 2 &frac14; cups), plus several chunks for the tops of the cookies", "&frac12; cup buckwheat flour", "2 tablespoons tapioca flour**", "&frac34; teaspoon baking powder", "2 large eggs, at room temperature***", "&frac12; cup plus 2 tablespoons cane sugar", "&frac12; teaspoon fine sea salt", "1 teaspoon vanilla extract", "Flaky salt such as Maldon, for the tops"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Position racks in the upper and lower thirds of the oven and preheat to 350 degrees Fahrenheit. Line 2 rimless cookie sheets with parchment paper.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/gluten-free-double-chocolate-cookies/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place the butter in a small, heavy-bottomed saucepan set over the lowest possible heat. Add 8 ounces of the chocolate (not all of it!) and melt together, stirring frequently to prevent the chocolate from scorching. Continue cooking until the mixture is pleasantly warm, but not super hot, to the touch. Remove from the heat and keep warm. Sift the buckwheat flour, tapioca flour and baking powder into a small bowl and set aside.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/gluten-free-double-chocolate-cookies/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Meanwhile, place the eggs, sugar and salt in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment and whip on medium-high speed until the mixture is very light and fluffy, 5 minutes (or use a mixing bowl and hand mixer). Turn the mixer to low and stir in the vanilla until just combined, then the warm chocolate butter mixture. Add the flour mixture and beat on low speed until combined. Remove the bowl from the mixer and use a flexible silicone spatula to fold in the remaining 4 ounces chopped chocolate.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/gluten-free-double-chocolate-cookies/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "If the batter is very runny, let it cool for a few minutes until it firms to the consistency of a thick brownie batter. Use a #40 spring-loaded ice cream scoop or 2 spoons to drop heaping tablespoons of batter onto the prepared baking sheets, spacing them at least 2 inches apart. Top each cookie with a few chunks of chocolate and a few flecks of flaky salt.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/gluten-free-double-chocolate-cookies/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake the cookies until puffed and cracked and the edges are set, 8\u201312 minutes, rotating the pans front to back and top to bottom halfway through baking. Let cool on the pans. Enjoy warm or at room temperature. The cookies are best the day of baking but will keep, airtight at room temperature, for up to 3 days.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/gluten-free-double-chocolate-cookies/#instruction-step-5"}], "prepTime": "PT25M", "cookTime": "PT10M", "totalTime": "PT35M", "recipeYield": ["30", "30 cookies"], "recipeCategory": "Cookie", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "27", "ratingValue": "4.9"}, "nutrition": {"servingSize": "1 cookie", "calories": "118 calories", "sugarContent": "8.8 g", "sodiumContent": "63.4 mg", "fatContent": "7 g", "saturatedFatContent": "4.1 g", "transFatContent": "0 g", "carbohydrateContent": "12.5 g", "fiberContent": "1.1 g", "proteinContent": "1.4 g", "cholesterolContent": "19.2 mg", "@type": "nutritionInformation"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Brenda Armstrong"}, "datePublished": "2019-11-13", "reviewBody": "These were fantastic...like a brownie or a flourless chocolate cake..but crispy on the outside...chocolaty inside with the chocolate pieces adding a bit of crunch here and there.  The flaked salt on the outside added another dimension of flavor.  I just bought a 48 oz bag of bittersweet chocolate chips so I can make them several more times!!  I've recommended your site to at least a dozen people!  such wonderful recipes... thanks again."}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Beth"}, "datePublished": "2020-04-26", "reviewBody": "This was my second buckwheat cookie I have ever made and it was DELICIOUS! Like a fudgy brownie. My whole family loved them! Recipe yields 2 large salads or 4 side salads.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "Kale and Brussels Sprouts Salad", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2013/03/kale-brussels-sprouts-salad-recipe-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2013/03/kale-brussels-sprouts-salad-recipe-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2013/03/kale-brussels-sprouts-salad-recipe-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2013/03/kale-brussels-sprouts-salad-recipe.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/raw-kale-and-brussels-sprouts-salad-with-tahini-maple-dressing/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 bunch of curly green kale", "12 Brussels sprouts (about &frac12; pound or 2 big handfuls&#8217; worth)", "&frac14; cup sliced almonds", "&frac14; cup shaved Parmesan, to taste (use a vegetable peeler to shave the cheese into little strips)", "Fine salt", "&frac14; cup tahini", "2 tablespoons white wine vinegar", "2 teaspoons white miso", "2 teaspoons maple syrup", "Pinch of red pepper flakes", "&frac14; cup water"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Use a chef&#8217;s knife to cut out the ribs of the kale leaves. Chop the kale into small, bite-sized pieces. Sprinkle salt lightly over the kale and use your hands to &#8220;massage&#8221; the kale by lightly scrunching handfuls of kale in your hands. Continue massaging until the kale becomes darker in color and more fragrant. Transfer the kale to a medium serving bowl.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/raw-kale-and-brussels-sprouts-salad-with-tahini-maple-dressing/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Chop off and discard the stem end of the Brussels sprouts and any discolored outer leaves. Either use your knife to slice the sprouts as thin as possible, or shred the sprouts in your food processor using the slicing disk. Add the sprouts to the bowl and use your fingers break up any clumps.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/raw-kale-and-brussels-sprouts-salad-with-tahini-maple-dressing/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a small mixing bowl, whisk together the tahini, vinegar, miso, maple syrup and red pepper flakes. Whisk in the water until the mixture is smooth and creamy. Some brands of tahini are thicker than others, so if your dressing is too thick, add a bit more water and/or vinegar, to taste. Pour the dressing over the kale and sprouts and mix well.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/raw-kale-and-brussels-sprouts-salad-with-tahini-maple-dressing/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a small pan over medium heat, toast the almonds, stirring frequently, until fragrant and turning golden (this will take less than five minutes so watch carefully). Add the toasted almonds and parmesan shavings to the salad and toss. Taste, and add more Parmesan if desired. It's comforting like mac and cheese, but lighter and full of vegetables! Just add pasta. Recipe yields about 4 cups sauce (enough to generously coat 12 ounces/4 modest servings of pasta).", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "pumpkin marinara sauce", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2017/10/creamy-pumpkin-marinara-recipe-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2017/10/creamy-pumpkin-marinara-recipe-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2017/10/creamy-pumpkin-marinara-recipe-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2017/10/creamy-pumpkin-marinara-recipe.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/creamy-pumpkin-marinara-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil", "1 yellow onion, chopped", "1 red bell pepper, chopped", "&frac12; teaspoon salt, divided", "2 cloves garlic, pressed or minced", "&frac12; teaspoon dried oregano", "&frac14; teaspoon dried tarragon", "&frac14; teaspoon ground cinnamon", "1 can (15 ounces) diced or crushed tomatoes", "1 can (15 ounces) pumpkin pur\u00e9e", "1 to 2 tablespoons butter", "1 to 2 teaspoons balsamic vinegar", "Freshly ground black pepper", "Finely grated Parmesan and chopped fresh parsley, for garnish (both optional)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Warm the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Once it\u2019s shimmering, add the onion, bell pepper and &frac14; teaspoon of the salt. Cook, stirring often, until the onions and pepper are very tender, 6 to 8 minutes.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/creamy-pumpkin-marinara-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the garlic, oregano, tarragon, and cinnamon. While stirring, cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add the tomatoes and cook for 1 minute, while stirring. Add the pumpkin pur\u00e9e and stir to combine. Continue simmering for 5 minutes, then remove it from the heat.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/creamy-pumpkin-marinara-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Carefully transfer the mixture to your blender. Add 1 tablespoon butter and 1 teaspoon vinegar. It's also very easy to make, as far as cheesecakes go! Recipe yields 12 slices.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "Basque cheesecake, easy cheesecake", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2023/02/basque-cheesecake-recipe-4-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2023/02/basque-cheesecake-recipe-4-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2023/02/basque-cheesecake-recipe-4-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2023/02/basque-cheesecake-recipe-4.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/basque-cheesecake-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["2 pounds cream cheese, at room temperature", "1 \u00bc to 1 \u00bd cups sugar, depending on desired level of sweetness\u00a0", "2 cups heavy cream, divided", "6 large eggs", "1 teaspoon vanilla extract", "\u00bd teaspoon fine salt", "\u2153 cup all-purpose flour"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place a rack in the middle of the oven, with no rack above it so the cheesecake has plenty of space to rise. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit. Tear off two generous sheets of parchment paper. Cross one on top of the other and press them into the base of a 9-inch springform pan. Roughly pleat the sides of the parchment against the pan to help make room for the cheesecake. Ideally, the paper will rise at least 2 inches all the way around the pan.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/basque-cheesecake-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large food processor (minimum 12-cup capacity), stand mixer or large mixing bowl (with a hand mixer), combine the cream cheese, sugar, and about \u00bd cup of the cream. Process (or mix on low speed) until the mixture is very smooth and the sugar has dissolved, pausing to scrape down the sides of the bowl as necessary, about 2 minutes.\u00a0", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/basque-cheesecake-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In the meantime, crack the eggs into a 2-cup liquid measuring cup. While blending, pour in all of the eggs at once and blend until smooth. Reserve the measuring cup.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/basque-cheesecake-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pause and scrape down the sides if necessary. Pour in the remaining cream, plus the vanilla and salt. Process until combined, about 30 seconds (this will take a little longer if using a mixer).", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/basque-cheesecake-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour 1 cup of the mixture into the measuring cup. Whisk the flour into the mixture until smooth (this prevents the flour from flying everywhere when mixed). Pour the contents of the cup back into the food processor and blend until smooth, about 10 to 20 seconds.\u00a0", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/basque-cheesecake-recipe/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour the batter into the prepared springform pan. Gently jiggle the pan to distribute the batter evenly. Take a moment to crease the folds of the paper more sharply so they rest against the side of the pan. Bake until the cheesecake is deeply golden brown on top and still very jiggly in the center, about 60 to 65 minutes.\u00a0", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/basque-cheesecake-recipe/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place the cheesecake on a cooling rack (it will fall dramatically as it cools). Let it cool for about an hour before serving it or refrigerating it for later, covered.\u00a0", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/basque-cheesecake-recipe/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To serve, release the outer piece of the pan and peel away the parchment from the sides of the cheesecake. Slice the cheesecake into wedges and enjoy. The cheesecake will keep well in the refrigerator for up to 5 days, or in the freezer for up to 3 months (the cheesecake is sliceable even when frozen, so you can thaw individual slices if preferred).", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/basque-cheesecake-recipe/#instruction-step-8"}], "prepTime": "PT30M", "cookTime": "PT1H", "totalTime": "PT1H30M", "recipeYield": ["12", "12 slices"], "recipeCategory": "Dessert", "cookingMethod": "Baked", "recipeCuisine": "Basque", "suitableForDiet": "VegetarianDiet", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "47", "ratingValue": "4.9"}, "nutrition": {"servingSize": "1 slice (made with lesser amount of sugar)", "calories": "463 calories", "sugarContent": "24.4 g", "sodiumContent": "375.5 mg", "fatContent": "35.7 g", "saturatedFatContent": "20.7 g", "transFatContent": "0.3 g", "carbohydrateContent": "28.4 g", "fiberContent": "0.1 g", "proteinContent": "8.7 g", "cholesterolContent": "192 mg", "@type": "nutritionInformation"}, "video": {"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "VideoObject", "name": "\u201dFoolproof", "description": "\u201dWatch", "contentUrl": "https://content.jwplatform.com/videos/&rdquo;Z6dWNgqu&rdquo;.mp4", "thumbnailUrl": ["https://content.jwplatform.com/thumbs/&rdquo;Z6dWNgqu&rdquo;-720.jpg"], "uploadDate": "1970-01-01T00:00:00+00:00"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Zabe"}, "datePublished": "2024-02-27", "reviewBody": "I made this once before and it was a complete hit! Slide the sweet potatoes into the oven and bake until very tender, about 45 minutes (mine took 5 to 10 minutes extra since they were a little bigger than specified).", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/sweet-potato-burrito-bowls-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a medium saucepan, combine the basmati rice, black beans, cumin, garlic, olive oil, tomato paste and salt. Pour 1 &frac14; cups water into the pot. Cover and bring to a boil over medium heat. Lower the heat to a simmer, and cook until all of the liquid is absorbed, about 40 minutes. Cover and set aside to keep the rice warm.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/sweet-potato-burrito-bowls-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make the rustic salsa: In a medium bowl, combine the bell pepper, cherry tomatoes, red onions, lime juice, cilantro and olive oil. Season the mixture with salt and pepper, and toss to combine. Set aside.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/sweet-potato-burrito-bowls-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make the guacamole: Peel the avocado and extract the pit. Place the avocado flesh in a medium bowl and mash with a fork. Once you&#8217;ve broken it up a bit, add the garlic, lime juice, cilantro and salt. Mash the avocado until the seasoning is evenly distributed and you have a chunky paste. Set aside.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/sweet-potato-burrito-bowls-recipe/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place each baked sweet potato in a shallow bowl. Trim the nubby ends and any discolored leaves off the Brussels sprouts, then cut the sprouts in half lengthwise.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/kung-pao-brussels-sprouts-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Transfer the sprouts to a large, rimmed baking sheet (I covered mine in parchment paper first for easy cleanup), then toss them with about 2 tablespoons olive oil, until they are coated with a light, even layer of oil. Arrange the sprouts in an even layer, flat sides down, and roast for 25 to 30 minutes, tossing halfway, until they are tender and deeply caramelized on the edges.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/kung-pao-brussels-sprouts-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Meanwhile, to prepare the sauce: In your smallest saucepan, add the tamari or soy sauce, honey or maple syrup, rice vinegar, sesame oil, &frac12; teaspoon sriracha and garlic. Whisk until combined, then taste and add more sriracha if you&#8217;d like (mine was just right with 1 &frac12; teaspoons sriracha, but I love spicy food).", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/kung-pao-brussels-sprouts-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bring the mixture to a boil over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally. Reduce heat to medium and cook, stirring often, until the sauce has thickened, about 4 to 5 minutes. It&#8217;s done when, if you take it off heat long enough for it to stop bubbling and carefully tilt the pan back and forth, the sauce will slide down the pan rather than slosh.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/kung-pao-brussels-sprouts-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Let the roasted sprouts cool for a few minutes, then transfer them to a medium serving bowl. Pour the sauce over the sprouts and toss to coat. Add the peanuts, green onion and optional cilantro and toss again. Serve immediately, with red pepper flakes sprinkled on top if you&#8217;d like a little extra heat (and color).", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/kung-pao-brussels-sprouts-recipe/#instruction-step-5"}], "prepTime": "PT15M", "cookTime": "PT30M", "totalTime": "PT45M", "recipeYield": ["4", "4 servings"], "recipeCategory": "Side", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "118", "ratingValue": "5"}, "nutrition": {"servingSize": null, "calories": "233 calories", "sugarContent": "14 g", "sodiumContent": "430.8 mg", "fatContent": "11.1 g", "saturatedFatContent": "1.6 g", "transFatContent": "0 g", "carbohydrateContent": "30.4 g", "fiberContent": "8.8 g", "proteinContent": "9.2 g", "cholesterolContent": "0 mg", "@type": "nutritionInformation"}, "video": {"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "VideoObject", "name": "\u201dKung", "description": "\u201dWatch", "contentUrl": "https://content.jwplatform.com/videos/&rdquo;RBNHFAq7&Prime;.mp4", "thumbnailUrl": ["https://content.jwplatform.com/thumbs/&rdquo;RBNHFAq7&Prime;-720.jpg"], "uploadDate": "1970-01-01T00:00:00+00:00"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Nathalie"}, "datePublished": "2023-01-25", "reviewBody": "Delish!"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Kay"}, "datePublished": "2023-01-27", "reviewBody": "Outstanding flavor!"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sam"}, "datePublished": "2023-04-14", "reviewBody": "SO GOOD, I'm making this for the second time this week, my toddler loves it too! Recipe yields about 2 cups whipped cream.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "whipped cream", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/12/whipped-cream-medium-peaks-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/12/whipped-cream-medium-peaks-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/12/whipped-cream-medium-peaks-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/12/whipped-cream-medium-peaks.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-whipped-cream-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 cup chilled heavy cream", "1 tablespoon maple syrup or honey or powdered sugar", "1 teaspoon vanilla extract"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "For quicker results, place your mixing bowl (either sturdy glass like Pyrex or stainless steel) and beaters (if using a hand mixer or stand mixer) in the freezer to chill for at least 15 minutes, or overnight.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-whipped-cream-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "When you&#8217;re ready to make whipped cream, combine the chilled cream, sweetener and vanilla extract in your bowl. Start blending at low speed and increase to medium-high.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-whipped-cream-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Continue blending until the cream increases by nearly double\u2014it might seem like you&#8217;re not doing much for a while, then the whipped cream will progress fairly quickly through stages.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-whipped-cream-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "continue blending until the mixture resembles melted ice cream and retains light swirl marks when you lift the mixer. For medium peaks, continue blending until the mixture retains more significant, closer-together swirl marks when you lift the mixer and mostly retains those swirl marks when you scoop it onto a spoon (this is the classic consistency that you would see dolloped on a pumpkin pie). For stiff peaks, continue blending until the mixture has tight swirl marks and resembles Cool Whip (you could ice a cake with this texture). Don&#8217;t overdo it, or your cream will start turning into butter!", "name": "For soft peaks,", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-whipped-cream-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Use whipped cream as desired. Whipped cream will keep well in the refrigerator, covered, for up to 5 days. If the mixture has separated a bit, gently stir it back together with a spoon. Recipe yields 4 generous or 6 more modest servings.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "Proven\u00e7al vegetable stew, end-of-summer recipe", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2019/09/best-ratatouille-recipe-1-1-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2019/09/best-ratatouille-recipe-1-1-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2019/09/best-ratatouille-recipe-1-1-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2019/09/best-ratatouille-recipe-1-1.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-ratatouille-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["2 pounds ripe red tomatoes (6 medium or 4 large)", "1 medium eggplant (1 pound), diced into &frac12;-inch cubes", "1 large red, orange, or yellow bell pepper (about 8 ounces), cut into &frac34;-inch squares", "1 medium-to-large zucchini (about 8 ounces), diced into &frac12;-inch cubes", "1 large yellow squash (about 8 ounces), diced into &frac12;-inch cubes", "5 tablespoons + 1 teaspoon extra-virgin olive oil, divided", "&frac34; teaspoon fine sea salt, divided, more to taste", "1 medium yellow onion, chopped", "4 cloves garlic, pressed or minced", "&frac14; cup chopped fresh basil", "&frac14; teaspoon red pepper flakes, more or less to taste", "&frac14; teaspoon dried oregano", "Freshly ground black pepper, to taste"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit with one rack in the middle of the oven and one in the upper third of the oven. Line two large, rimmed baking sheets with parchment paper for easy clean-up, if desired.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-ratatouille-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To prepare your tomatoes, remove any woody cores with a paring knife. Then, grate them on the large holes of a box grater into a bowl (this is easiest if you hold the tomato at a diagonal), and chop any remaining tomato skin. Or, blitz the tomatoes in a food processor until they are broken into a frothy pulp. Set aside.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-ratatouille-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "On one baking sheet, toss the diced eggplant with 2 tablespoons of the olive oil until lightly coated. Arrange the eggplant in a single layer across the pan, sprinkle with &frac14; teaspoon of the salt, and set aside.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-ratatouille-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "On the other baking sheet, toss the bell pepper, zucchini and yellow squash with 1 tablespoon of olive oil and &frac14; teaspoon salt. Arrange the vegetables in a single layer. Place the eggplant pan on the middle rack and the other vegetables on the top rack. Set the timer for 15 minutes.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-ratatouille-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Meanwhile, warm 2 tablespoons of the olive oil in a large Dutch oven or soup pot over medium heat. Add the onion and &frac14; teaspoon salt. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the onion is tender and caramelizing on the edges, about 8 to 10 minutes.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-ratatouille-recipe/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the garlic, stir, and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add the tomatoes, and use a wooden spoon or sturdy silicone spatula to stir any browned bits stuck to the bottom of the pan into the mixture. Reduce the heat to medium-low, or as necessary to maintain a gentle simmer.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-ratatouille-recipe/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Once 15 minutes are up, remove both pans from the oven, stir, and redistribute the contents of each evenly across the pans. This time, place the eggplant on the top rack and other vegetables on the middle rack.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-ratatouille-recipe/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake until the eggplant is nice and golden on the edges, about 10 more minutes (the eggplant will be done sooner than the rest). Remove the eggplant from the oven, and carefully stir the eggplant into the simmering tomato sauce.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-ratatouille-recipe/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Let the squash and bell pepper pan continue to bake until the peppers are caramelized, about 5 to 10 more minutes. Then, transfer the contents of the pan into the simmering sauce. Continue simmering for 5 more minutes to give the flavors time to meld.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-ratatouille-recipe/#instruction-step-9"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove the pot from the heat. Stir in 1 teaspoon olive oil, the fresh basil and red pepper flakes. Crumble the dried oregano between your fingers as you drop it into the pot. Season to taste with additional salt (I usually add &frac14; teaspoon more) and black pepper.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-ratatouille-recipe/#instruction-step-10"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Serve in bowls, perhaps with a little drizzle of olive oil, additional chopped basil, or black pepper on top (all optional). Like all stews, this ratatouille&#8217;s flavor improves as it cools. It&#8217;s even better reheated the next day. It's gluten free, filling and delicious. Recipe yields 4 medium salads, or 8 small side servings.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "arugula wild rice salad, wild rice stuffing", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2015/08/arugula-wild-rice-salad-recipe-4-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2015/08/arugula-wild-rice-salad-recipe-4-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2015/08/arugula-wild-rice-salad-recipe-4-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2015/08/arugula-wild-rice-salad-recipe-4.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/arugula-wild-rice-salad-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 cup wild rice, rinsed", "&frac12; cup sliced almonds", "1 teaspoon olive oil", "5 ounces arugula (about 5 packed cups)", "&frac12; cup coarsely chopped fresh basil (from one &#8532; ounce container)", "&frac12; cup dried tart cherries or cranberries, chopped", "&frac12; cup crumbled feta or goat cheese (about 2 ounces)", "&frac14; cup olive oil", "2 tablespoons lemon juice (from 1 medium lemon), to taste", "2 teaspoons Dijon mustard", "1 teaspoon honey or maple syrup", "1 medium clove garlic, pressed or minced", "&frac14; teaspoon fine sea salt, to taste", "Freshly ground black pepper, to taste"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To cook the wild rice, bring a large pot of water to boil. Add the rinsed rice and continue boiling, reducing heat as necessary to prevent overflow, for 40 minutes to 55 minutes, until the rice is pleasantly tender but still offers a light resistance to the bite. Remove from heat, drain the rice and return the rice to pot. Cover and let the rice rest for 10 minutes, then remove the lid and let the rice cool.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/arugula-wild-rice-salad-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To toast the almonds, warm one teaspoon olive oil in a small skillet over medium-low heat. Add the almonds and a pinch of salt and cook until they\u2019re turning lightly golden and fragrant, about 4 to 5 minutes, stirring frequently. Set aside to cool.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/arugula-wild-rice-salad-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a small bowl, whisk together the dressing ingredients until blended.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/arugula-wild-rice-salad-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To assemble the salad, transfer the cooled rice to a large bowl. Add the arugula, chopped basil, almonds, sour cherries and feta. Pour in the dressing, toss well, and season to taste with additional salt (I usually add another pinch or two) and pepper. If the salad needs more fresh, bright flavor, add up to 1 tablespoon more lemon juice.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/arugula-wild-rice-salad-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Set the salad aside for 10 minutes before serving, to give the rice time to soak up some of the dressing.\u00a0This salad keeps well in the refrigerator, covered, for two to three days. You might need to wake up leftovers with an extra drizzle of olive oil and squeeze of lemon (the rice absorbs the dressing over time).", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/arugula-wild-rice-salad-recipe/#instruction-step-5"}], "prepTime": "PT15M", "cookTime": "PT40M", "totalTime": "PT55M", "recipeYield": ["4", "4 servings"], "recipeCategory": "Salad", "cookingMethod": "Stovetop", "recipeCuisine": "American", "suitableForDiet": "VegetarianDiet", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "120", "ratingValue": "5"}, "nutrition": {"servingSize": "1 medium salad", "calories": "490 calories", "sugarContent": "17.9 g", "sodiumContent": "337.1 mg", "fatContent": "26.3 g", "saturatedFatContent": "4.7 g", "transFatContent": "0 g", "carbohydrateContent": "54.8 g", "fiberContent": "7.2 g", "proteinContent": "13.3 g", "cholesterolContent": "11 mg", "@type": "nutritionInformation"}, "video": {"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "VideoObject", "name": "\u201dArugula", "description": "\u201dWatch", "contentUrl": "https://content.jwplatform.com/videos/&rdquo;jcvPAf1W&rdquo;.mp4", "thumbnailUrl": ["https://content.jwplatform.com/thumbs/&rdquo;jcvPAf1W&rdquo;-720.jpg"], "uploadDate": "1970-01-01T00:00:00+00:00"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Susan"}, "datePublished": "2021-10-23", "reviewBody": "We've returned to this recipe time and time again. The granola will further crisp up as it cools.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/healthy-granola-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Let the granola cool completely, undisturbed (at least 45 minutes). Break the granola into pieces with your hands if you want to retain big chunks, or stir it around with a spoon if you don&#8217;t want extra-clumpy granola.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/healthy-granola-recipe/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Store the granola in an airtight container at room temperature for 1 to 2 weeks, or in a sealed freezer bag in the freezer for up to 3 months. Cook with me!", "sameAs": ["https://cookieandkate.com/about/"]}, {"@context": "https://schema.org/", "@type": "Recipe", "name": "Mediterranean Roasted Sweet Potato & Farro Salad", "description": "This hearty roasted sweet potato and farro salad has delicious a Middle Eastern spin to it, thanks to the sumac, lemon, mint and ricotta salata. Recipe yields 2 large servings or 3 to 4 more modest servings.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/03/mediterranean-sweet-potato-farro-salad-recipe-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/03/mediterranean-sweet-potato-farro-salad-recipe-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/03/mediterranean-sweet-potato-farro-salad-recipe-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/03/mediterranean-sweet-potato-farro-salad-recipe.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/mediterranean-sweet-potato-farro-salad-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["&frac34; cup farro (the semi-pearled variety cooks faster)", "1 pound sweet potatoes (1 large or 2 small), peeled and sliced into 1\u201d cubes", "1 to 2 tablespoons olive oil, plus more for drizzling", "2 teaspoons ground sumac (optional but recommended)", "Salt, to taste", "Freshly ground black pepper, to taste", "1 bunch Tuscan kale (also known as Lacinato kale), ribs removed and chopped into bite-sized pieces", "1 small red onion, halved and thinly sliced", "2 tablespoons red wine vinegar", "2 tablespoons sugar or honey or maple syrup", "1 medium lemon", "1 handful fresh mint leaves", "3 tablespoons roughly chopped hazelnuts", "&#8531; cup (about 2 ounces) crumbled salata cheese or feta cheese (optional)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit. To cook the farro: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil over high heat. Add the farro, then reduce heat to maintain a simmer. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the farro is tender to the bite but still pleasantly chewy (pearled farro will take as little as 15 minutes; unprocessed farro will take 25 to 40 minutes). Drain off the excess water and return the farro to the pot. Set aside.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/mediterranean-sweet-potato-farro-salad-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To roast the sweet potatoes: Line a large, rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper for easy cleanup. Place the cubed sweet potato on the pan and drizzle with enough olive oil to lightly coat the sweet potatoes. Sprinkle the sumac over the sweet potatoes, followed by salt and pepper, then toss until the sweet potatoes are thoroughly coated in oil and spices. Arrange the sweet potatoes in a single layer and roast for 20 to 30 minutes, tossing halfway, until they are caramelized on the edges and tender when pierced with a fork.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/mediterranean-sweet-potato-farro-salad-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To pickle the onion: In a small pan or medium pot, combine the onion, vinegar, sugar and &frac12; cup water. Cook over medium heat, occasionally swirling the pan, for 4 to 8 minutes, or until the sugar has dissolved and the liquid is slightly reduced in volume. Remove from heat and set aside.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/mediterranean-sweet-potato-farro-salad-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Once the farro is done cooking, add the chopped kale to the pot. Drizzle with olive oil, then stir to combine. Season with salt (I added &frac14; teaspoon) and pepper, to taste.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/mediterranean-sweet-potato-farro-salad-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To assemble the salad: Drain the excess liquid from the pickled onions, then add the onions to the pot of farro and kale. Add the roasted sweet potatoes and squeeze an entire lemon\u2019s worth of juice into the pot. Stir to combine and season generously with salt and pepper, to taste. Divide the salad into individual bowls and top each one with mint leaves, chopped hazelnuts and crumbled cheese.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/mediterranean-sweet-potato-farro-salad-recipe/#instruction-step-5"}], "prepTime": "PT20M", "cookTime": "PT40M", "totalTime": "PT1H", "recipeYield": ["2", "2 to 4 servings"], "recipeCategory": "Salad", "recipeCuisine": "Mediterranean", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "35", "ratingValue": "4.9"}, "nutrition": {"servingSize": null, "calories": "360 calories", "sugarContent": "11.3 g", "sodiumContent": "760.1 mg", "fatContent": "11.3 g", "saturatedFatContent": "2.9 g", "transFatContent": "0 g", "carbohydrateContent": "54.7 g", "fiberContent": "9.5 g", "proteinContent": "10.6 g", "cholesterolContent": "12.6 mg", "@type": "nutritionInformation"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Jen"}, "datePublished": "2019-10-28", "reviewBody": "Delicious! We had some leftover ricotta salata that I had bought for pasta Alla Norma that I did not want to go to waste so I used it with this recipe. (I've been making that pasta dish for years from a family recipe so I did not make your version, Kate. I did use your idea of roasting the eggplant in the oven instead of frying it how I always did in the past. roasting is much easier to clean up and doesn't make the mess that frying does.) \r\n\r\nThis salad is really easy and will definitely be something that we will make again. I still do not have any sumac so, instead, I used zaatar which has sumac in it. Also, I could not find any lacinito so I used baby kale and it was fine. I had just about resigned myself to the fact that I was going to need to use pepitas in this because I was having a hard time finding hazelnuts at the stores I usually go to. They're easy to find around Thanksgiving but can be hard to find at other times. The last store I went to had them and after eating the salad I thought it was worth the effort to find the hazelnuts. I wish that I had made more of the pickled onion. It was so good. I can't wait to make this for my daughter, that is a vegan, when she is home from school this summer (without the ricotta salata and using maple syrup or agave for the onions)."}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sarah"}, "datePublished": "2021-04-06", "reviewBody": "So good! The original availability of Olive oil in the Mediterranean caused it to be made with it and the actual original process was with a mortar and is really tedious... while your recipie is delicious, it is more a sister of Mayo as it is garlic mayo instead of Alioli. For sure is really similar and good enough. \r\n\r\nIf you have a hand blender, try taking out the vein of the garlic cloves, add some oil, sea salt and lime juice and slowly go from bottom up following the emulsion untill everything is fully integrated. No vein makes garlic to taste smoother while it is fully egg free."}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Juliet"}, "datePublished": "2023-09-23", "reviewBody": "Best sauce in the world. (More on that in a minute! Spoiler...it went well...so read to the end if you require same!)\r\nPlease don't be an omniv snob...vegan mayos are a whole lot better than they used to be.\r\nI have subbed best foods vegan mayo in picnic potato salad...non vegans have only asked, \"where are the eggs?\"\r\nBut still had no problem going back for 2nds &amp; 3rds...\r\n\r\nSoaking the garlic in lemon juice is genius! Do not skip this step.\r\nI went off script a bit &amp; used jalapeno salt.\r\nI drained liquid (am reserving garlic for a 2nd use, plenty of life &amp; flavor yet!) &amp; added approx 2 tbsp best foods vegan mayo. Added approx 1/4 tsp Kala namak (aka \"black\" or \"sulfur\" salt...this is a specialty item, optional but worth it, adds a deep \"egg\" flavor...fyi, it is not really \"black\", colorwise, more a pinky-tan...) Do not use black Hawaiian salt, it is dark from mineral content, flavor is basically sea salt, best as a sprinkle, strong dark color can mess up what you're doing....\r\nAdded approx 2 tsp nutritional yeast for color &amp; umani.\r\nAdded approx 1 tsp of good olive oil....\r\nIn part bcuz I agreed with the hubs...aioli needs to have olive oil! Plus...this added a richness I do not think I could have otherwise achieved.\r\nHey, this is going on a lunch prep vegan sandwich. \r\nWhole grain rye, peppered tofurky, mustard greens &amp; possibly tomato...\r\nCarrot sticks, sliced bell peppers &amp; fruit side....\r\nI am already looking forward to lunch tomorrow...!!!"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Nenette"}, "datePublished": "2024-11-01", "reviewBody": "Delicious! To make multiples, simply repeat the ingredients and instructions below (cook each batch separately for best results).", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "vegetarian collard greens", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2019/03/bestcollard-greens-recipe-3-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2019/03/bestcollard-greens-recipe-3-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2019/03/bestcollard-greens-recipe-3-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2019/03/bestcollard-greens-recipe-3.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/quick-collard-greens-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 large bunch (about 10 ounces) collard greens", "1 &frac12; tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil", "&frac14; teaspoon fine sea salt", "2 medium cloves garlic, pressed or minced", "Pinch of red pepper flakes (optional, scale back or omit if sensitive to spice)", "A couple lemon wedges, for serving"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To prepare the collards: Cut out the thick center rib out of each collard green. Stack the rib-less greens and roll them up into a cigar-like shape. Slice over the &#8220;cigar&#8221; as thinly as possible (\u215b\u2033 to \u00bc\u2033) to make long strands. This meal is great for dinner, too! Recipe yields 4 bowls.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/06/tex-mex-breakfast-bowl-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/06/tex-mex-breakfast-bowl-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/06/tex-mex-breakfast-bowl-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/06/tex-mex-breakfast-bowl.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/tex-mex-breakfast-bowl-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 pint cherry or grape tomatoes, quartered", "&frac14; cup finely chopped white onion (about &frac14; small onion)", "&frac14; cup chopped fresh cilantro", "1 tablespoon lime juice (about &frac12; medium lime)", "&frac14; teaspoon fine-grain sea salt", "1 tablespoon olive oil", "&frac12; cup finely chopped white onion (about &frac12; small onion)", "2 teaspoons Frontier Co-op ground cumin", "&frac12; teaspoon Frontier Co-op garlic powder or 2 cloves garlic, pressed or minced", "2 cans (15 ounces each) black beans, rinsed and drained, or 3 cups cooked black beans", "&frac12; cup water", "&frac12; teaspoon fine-grain sea salt", "Freshly ground black pepper, to taste", "1 teaspoon lime juice", "10 eggs", "3 tablespoons cream or neutral-flavored milk of choice", "\u00bc teaspoon fine-grain sea salt", "Freshly ground black pepper", "Pinch of Frontier Co-op red pepper flakes", "2 teaspoons olive oil", "\u00bd cup grated Monterey Jack cheese or cheddar cheese, optional", "1 ripe avocado, thinly sliced", "Your favorite salsa", "Roasted breakfast potatoes, optional"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To make the pico de gallo: In a small mixing bowl, combine all of the ingredients. Stir to combine, and set the pico de gallo aside to marinate while you make the remaining components.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/tex-mex-breakfast-bowl-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To cook the black beans: In a medium saucepan over medium heat, warm the olive oil until shimmering. Add the chopped onion and a sprinkle of salt. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the onion has softened and is turning translucent, about 5 to 8 minutes. Add the cumin and garlic. Cook, stirring constantly, until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Pour in the drained beans and water. Stir, cover and cook for 5 minutes.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/tex-mex-breakfast-bowl-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Reduce the heat to low, remove the lid and use a potato masher or the back of a fork to mash up about at least half of the beans. Continue to cook the beans, uncovered, stirring often, for 3 more minutes. Remove the saucepan from the heat and stir in the salt, pepper and lime juice. Taste and add more salt, pepper, lime juice if necessary. If the beans seem dry, add a very small splash of water and stir to combine. Cover until you&#8217;re ready to serve.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/tex-mex-breakfast-bowl-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To cook the eggs:\u00a0In a medium mixing bowl, scramble the eggs with the cream or milk, salt, a few twists of freshly ground black pepper and a pinch of red pepper flakes. In a 10-inch non-stick or well-seasoned cast iron skillet, warm 2 teaspoons olive oil over medium heat until shimmering. Swirl the pan so it&#8217;s evenly coated with oil. Whisk your egg mixture one last time and pour it into the skillet.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/tex-mex-breakfast-bowl-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Scramble the eggs by pushing the mixture around until it\u2019s about 90 percent set. I am not a huge fan of raw radishes (my husband loves them), but these are so good! We have a lot of radishes in our garden so this will be a summer staple. I used a mandoline to shave thin slices (6-7 radishes packed full a half pint jar) and adjusted the measurements of the ingredients accordingly. Would cut down the honey next time (by half). Used 1/4+ crushed red pepper and it was perfect. My husband loved them, as well! Perfect for burgers and Mexican food. When I was mixing it, I felt that there wasn\u2019t enough moisture, and perhaps adding those two things might warrant a wee bit more of the honey and oil, so I topped them both up. The granola was more chewy than crunchy.   Any thoughts if that was due to the bit of extra liquids? Did I panic for nothing? Remember, I don\u2019t have a knack for baking.\r\n\r\nI have a bee in my bonnet about crunchy granola, but this is so delicious I  am inclined not to do anything differently. It doesn\u2019t need anywhere close to one minute. Lol.). Although previous experience tells me that the trick isn\u2019t letting it absolutely fully cool. The parchment paper will make it easy for you to slice the bars later.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-granola-bars-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place the oats in a large mixing bowl**. Add the cinnamon and salt, and stir to combine. Set aside.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-granola-bars-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Now we&#8217;ll blitz the mix-ins briefly in the food processor or blender (or, you can chop them by hand). Add any large nuts (like almonds or pecans) first and blitz for a few seconds. Then add the rest and run the machine for a few more seconds, until the ingredients are all broken up into pieces smaller than your pinky nail. Pour the mix-ins into the bowl of oats.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-granola-bars-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a 2-cup liquid measuring cup, measure out the nut butter. Top with \u00bd cup honey and the vanilla extract. Stir until well blended. If you must, you can gently warm the liquid mixture on the stovetop or in the microwave, but make sure it\u2019s close to room temperature before you pour it into the dry mixture (this is especially important if using chocolate, since it will melt).", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-granola-bars-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour the liquid ingredients into the dry ingredients. Use a big spoon to mix them together until the two are evenly combined and no dry oats remain. This takes some arm muscles, but you can do it! If the mixture was easy to mix together, that\u2019s a sign that you need to add some more oats\u2014sprinkle in more oats until you can\u2019t incorporate any more.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-granola-bars-recipe/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Transfer the mixture to the prepared square baker. Use your spoon to arrange the mixture fairly evenly in the baker, then use the bottom of a flat, round surface (like a short, sturdy drinking glass) to pack the mixture down as firmly and evenly as possible.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-granola-bars-recipe/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cover the baker and refrigerate for at least one hour, or preferably overnight. (The oats need time to soak up some of the moisture so they aren\u2019t sticky.) When you\u2019re ready to slice, lift the bars out of the baker by grabbing both pieces of parchment paper on opposite corners. Use a sharp knife to slice the bars into 4 even columns and 4 even rows.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-granola-bars-recipe/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Wrap individual bars in plastic wrap or parchment paper (if you store them all together, they will stick to one another). I am not one to alter recipes and then post a review of basically a whole new recipe haha! But I do have to say that I had to pivot because I ran out of peanut butter! Yeah not my day. So here's what my first batch consisted of: Exactly as written however I used 1/2c regular organic creamy pb and 1/2c pb made with PB2 chocolate powder!! So good! My mix in's were almonds, walnuts, pepitas, mixed dried berries and apricots. I used honey as the sweetener. Today, the second batch I made, I used 100% PB2 powder but 1/2 regular and 1/2 chocolate. The sweetener I used was half honey and half maple syrup (I ran out of honey this time!)  Feedback to myself is 1) PB2 powder is a no-brainer for this, 2) These are best if they sit overnight 3) I prefer the flavor of honey as the sweetener and 4) don't skip the salt! Everyone loves these. I'll be making them regularly. Too easy not to! The peanut butter was more evenly dispersed the second time around. Cook with me!", "sameAs": ["https://cookieandkate.com/about/"]}, {"@context": "https://schema.org/", "@type": "Recipe", "name": "Spicy Red Pepper &amp; Feta Dip (Htipiti)", "description": "This bold and spicy roasted red pepper and feta dip is inspired by a traditional Greek recipe (htipiti). It's so easy to make and guaranteed to be a hit! Recipe yields 1 1/2 cups and is easily doubled.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "Greek red pepper feta dip, htipiti, tirokafteri", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2019/10/spicy-red-pepper-feta-dip-recipe-2-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2019/10/spicy-red-pepper-feta-dip-recipe-2-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2019/10/spicy-red-pepper-feta-dip-recipe-2-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2019/10/spicy-red-pepper-feta-dip-recipe-2.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/spicy-red-pepper-feta-dip-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["One 8-ounce block of feta cheese, patted dry and cut into 1&#8243; chunks or large crumbles (about 1 &#8532; cups)", "&frac12; cup roasted red peppers, patted dry and roughly chopped (1 to 1 &frac12; peppers)", "&frac14; cup extra-virgin olive oil, plus additional for garnish", "1 tablespoon lemon juice", "&frac14; teaspoon cayenne pepper (omit if sensitive to spice)", "Freshly ground black pepper, to taste", "Crushed red pepper flakes, for garnishing (optional)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In the bowl of your food processor, combine the feta, bell pepper, olive oil, lemon juice, cayenne pepper, and about 10 twists of freshly ground black pepper.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/spicy-red-pepper-feta-dip-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Process until the mixture is orange, fairly smooth, and you no longer see any big chunks of feta. Don&#8217;t overdo it; small bits of feta are good and over-processing this dip will make it gritty. Taste, and add additional cayenne pepper (up to &frac14; teaspoon more) if you want it to be extra spicy. I first tried it 20 years ago at D.C.'s late and great Marvelous Market, and immediately fell in love...right before they discontinued it. It's not easy to find, and I went years without it until I signed up for a farm box/CSA. Then THEY stopped carrying it. I often thought, \"I just need to learn to make it, then I'll ALWAYS have it\", but none of the recipes I researched resembled the superior Marvelous Market version-- until yours. \r\n\r\nWith a Costco-sized vat of feta and several forgotten peppers on the line, I hoped for the best, even though I was using the wrong texture of cheese and I don't have a food processor/the healthy shoulder joints to combine it by hand. I made it in my mom's ancient Osterizer blender, and that poor thing started emitting the saddest little noises, but it persevered! Do not use a blender unless, like me, you have no choice. Not unless you want to smell metal. \r\n\r\nMy first attempt (as you wrote it) was pleasant, but still not as zingy as what I remembered. I had some jalapenos and garlic that needed to be finished so I threw caution to the wind and added those, since I knew they would work (Let me explain: there is an amazing Greek restaurant in D.C. that spawned a national, fast casual chain called Cava-- they make a different, also legendary dip called \"Crazy Feta\" with Dodonis feta, jalapenos, onion...it is addictive and something like $12 for a small container at Whole Foods IF yours is lucky enough to carry it ). \r\n\r\nSince I was already disrespecting your instructions, I remembered what a late Greek aunt once told me and threw in some Greek pepperoncini brine, with the four jalapenos and multiple garlic cloves and BAM. There it was. The dip I've searched everywhere for, since the late '90s. I know it's a cliche to leave a comment on a recipe blog bragging about how you used wholly unrelated ingredients, but two things:\r\n\r\n1) on the off-chance someone else from D.C. is reading this, I want them to be delighted, too\r\n\r\n2) This sort of riffing is not possible without a bedrock of greatness (you! your hard work!!) and a decent palate/some skills in the kitchen. I knew what I wanted, but had no way to get there until today. You, Kate, are the wind beneath my orange cheese-stained wings. Thank you. I'm so happy you lit the way for me with your outstanding blog. I HAVE SO MUCH HTIPITI I AM ECSTATIC.
